36656342.review:
THIS REVIEW IS MY OWN UNBIASED OPINION - I was not compensated for this review in any way, shape, or form.


Slay the Spire is a turn-based card-collecting roguelike dungeon crawler, at least that's how I'd describe it.  Essentially you pick 1 of the available classes to start out in your adventure, with a basic deck of cards to get you going.  You then plunge into the depths of a dungeon, and will encounter monsters, Elite monsters, loot chests, randomized scenarios, merchants, campfires, and Boss monsters as you plug along, surviving as long as you can and collecting more cards and relics.  Between each "room" you have a map to view the tree of each series of floors, and you can plan your way through and choose between forks in the paths to either get some treasure, see a merchant, avoid/fight an Elite, etc.

Combat is simple, straight-forward, and user friendly - The game is 100% turn-based, so you have plenty of time to plan your moves to be as efficient as you can, and there are numerous buffs and debuffs that can be on you or the enemy - all of which can be hovered over to see their effects, which is super handy (non of that "what the fuck is this green toxic buff on me what is it what's it doing????" shit you see in some games).  You take turns using cards to peform various actions, and you can see your enemies' "intent" for their turn, allowing you to prepare for an incoming attack or debuff.  Combat and the game ends when you die, if you survive and defeat the enemy; you continue.

There are several types of cards, I won't go into too much detail since it'd take 3 paragraphs to explain, but you got different skills you can use, attack cards, defense cards, and some situational cards.  There is a LOT of variety in cards, with some making a huge difference in how you want to build your deck.  Notes on the Store Page say more cards and things will be added, I'm really excited about this.

In terms of aesthetics; the game is quite pleasing to the eye.  The art is pretty, the characters and enemies look cool, the in-game sounds are accurate and high-quality, the music is catchy, and there's a decent amount of spell/card effects, so that when you do something cool, it actually looks cool (no visually dull combat here).

I picked up this game and immediately played it for 2-3 hours; I made it through 2 Bosses on my first run, died almost instantly on my second run, then completed the game (sorta?  You don't really "beat" roguelikes, there's still LOTS to do, I just made it through enough bosses to uhhhhh, do some spoiler-y stuff) on my third run.  I will definitely be playing this a lot more, especially if more content and classes are added.

This game is very well polished for an Early Access title; I found absolutely no bugs, and didn't experience a single crash.  The developer is obviously very competent.  It's also a very cheap game for the fun it offers.  I'm only 2-3 hours in, and I already consider my $15.99 purchase completely worth it.

I wish there were more games as good as this one!  Just need to get those other classes and more cards added ;)

OVERALL RATING: 9/10

36644277.review:
Imaginemos que ya estas en edad de salir. Me apuesto mi biblioteca de Steam a que alguna vez has llegado a casa algo perjudicado (por supuesto la culpa es del pollo que cenaste, que a saber con qué lo alimentaron) y te ha entrado el gusanillo de hacerte algo para comer antes de irte a dormirla. 

El mundo del mañaneo tiene una similitud muy tocha con el videojueguil, que es muy dado a las mezclas. Algunas de ellas te salen de estrella michelín y otras son justo lo que necesitabas para irte al baño y "evacuar" los líquidos y sólidos  de la noche anterior.

¿Será Slay the Spire ese cacho de pizza recalentado que a las 12 de la noche tenía una pinta horrible pero que a las 8 de la mañana es caviar puro para tu paladar? ¿O por el contrario será ese sandwich de chorizo, nocilla y sardinas que aún a día de hoy te ha dejado un regusto infernal?. 

Es muy posible que no pueda darte solución a esta duda trascendental,pero intentaré poner el modo Arguiñano on ( chistes verdes incluidos en un DLC a parte) para explicarte querid@ lector@ los ingredientes del potaje que Slay The Spire (STS) representa 

A los cinco minutos de jugarlo está muy clarito que para realizar este plato vas a necesitar 1kg de Juegos de Cartas y otro kilito de roguelike. Creo que lo único que queda por fusionar con el género rogue a día de hoy es el Brecol, sin embargo, la mezcla que STS nos presenta, lejos de ser empalagosa y suponer el enésimo título de algo sobresaturado, presenta dos géneros que tampoco son los que se nos presenten juntos y revueltos con mayor frecuencia. Es un soplo sin duda alguna, a lo mejor no fresco como si te echasen el aliento despues de un buffet libre de mentolados pero se agradece.

La cuestion es, ¿casan bien estos elementos o se te van a repetir cual chorizo de la aldea con ajos toda la tarde?. Por un lado, en STS se te presentan elementos roguelike de toda la vida, a saber: mapas generados de manera aleatoria con distintos recorridos para elegir, múltiples eventos dentro de ese mapa (mercaderes, combates, eventos de "texto", cofres, etc) y un jefe final con ganas de darte candela al final de cada mapa. Por otro se nos presenta un juego de cartas con un mazo que dictará tus acciones en combate y que podrá interactuar con ciertas opciones del mapamundi.

En STS hay dos personajes a elegir. Cada uno de ellos empieza con un mazo cerrado muy similar (hay que decir que el mazo inicial tiene una calidad tal, que hay chicles masticados en E Bay que dicen que tienen más valor). La chicha está en que a medida que avanzamos el juego, se nos darán a elegir cartas como recompensas, (aquí es donde los dos personajes se diferencian de verdad, ya que cada uno tiene su set de cartas de posibles recompensas único).

 De manera muy general, las cartas que ofrece el juego se dividen en; ataque (para dialogar democráticamente con los enemigos), defensa ( armadura rica para amortiguar los toñazos del rival) y poderes cuyo efecto permanecerá todo el combate una vez jugada la carta correspondiente.

Ahora vas, te pillas el juego, empiezas con un mazo básico y le metes todas las cartas reshulonas que te vayan ofreciendo hasta que tu deck tenga el grosor de la Enciclopedia D´Agostini y ale, a triunfar. Probablemente esta sea la estrategia a seguir si lo que quieres es ver un GAME OVER bien gordote. 

Cierto es que, prácticamente todas las cartas suponen una mejora respecto a las básicas pero hay que tener en cuenta que cuantas más cartas metas, menos probabilidades tendrá de salirte una carta concreta. ¿Y esto es mu grave Doctor,pensarás?. Pues para unos días de baja tienes. El combate se divide muy claramente en dos fases, en una el enemigo intentará, darte cera, en esta fase, probablemente suspires por tener esas cartas que aumentan tu armadura, y en otra los bichejos se defenderá o intentarán tirarse bufos. Aquí sería ideal que rompas con furia tu Pijama del Primarkt y que juegues todo tu repertorio de fogonazos y perradas varias.

¿ Cuál es el problema de tener un mazo desequilibrado?. Si te has pasado metiendo cartas de un solo tipo hasta reventar, puede por ejemplo que para cuando llegue la fase de defensa no tengas ni un triste block ( y créeme, algunas toñas del rival hacen más daño que la grulla de Karate Kid). Además, los desarrolladores en pleno éxtasis de buenrollismo han decidido que las cartas que no juegues en cada mano, se vuelvan al mazo mientras robas una mano nueva. Por lo tanto, aquí no te llegará con robar una vez esa carta 360MLGnoscopegitgud, sino que necesitarás un mazo equilibrado para que no te falte de nada y con el tamaño adecuado para que las cartas tochas aparezcan con frecuencia.


 Pero tranquilidad, no todo es muerte y desolación, en STS puedes poner a dieta a tu mazo, evitando que se infle más que un luchador de sumo en la Fábrica de Chocolate. En determinados eventos tendrás la posibilidad de eliminar cartas de tu mazo. Suena muy mal pero créeme, es toda una bendición. De esta manera podrás quitarte cartas debiluchas del principio y así aumentar la posibilidad de que cada vez que robes, sea una de las recompensas que has elegido.

Si has  conseguido leer hasta aquí, lo primero de todo sería darte mi mas sincera enhorabuena y agradecimientos eternos ( lo siento si no estuviese tan canino hasta te mandaría un pin o algo a casa) y lo segundo sería responder a la duda más que razonable de ¿hay algo más a parte de cartas y  bofetones?. La respuesta es "siempre hay algo que se nos escapa", como ese hueso de aceituna que se cuela en un bote que tú juras y perjuras que  ponía DESHUESADAS. Además de cartas, en STS podemos encontrar reliquias (de diferente rareza y calidad) fundamentalmente lo que nos van a aportar las reliquias son efectos pasivos. Algunos suponen un simple bufo, pero otros pueden llegar a darnos efectos que marquen por completo la estrategia de nuestro mazo. Añádele un toque final de algún que otro desbloqueable según juegas, así como logros que cazar y ya tenemos menú.

En definitiva, Slay the Spire es eso que llaman un deckbuilding roguelike. La clave del éxito está en elegir adecuadamente las recompensas que se te ofrecerán (intentando ir creando un mazo con sinergias coherentes) y a la vez en mantener un tamaño adecuado a base de intentar eliminar las cartas más flojuchas. La mezcla resultante en mi opinión, no es ninguna cerdada que nos cocinamos de renganche sino que tiene su regustito. Si eres un@ amante de los juegos de cartas y los roguelikes puede que tengas que ir dándole ya la vara a los Reyes Magos para que este título forme parte de tu biblioteca.

Ya va siendo hora de pirarse, que tanto hablar de mezclas exquisitas me ha hecho recordar que tengo unas anchoas con mantequilla en la nevera a las que les quedaría de lujo una morcilla y unos mejillones.

36630351.review:
I really, REALLY wanted to love this game, but it is just too luck dependent. Notice, I didn't say "too hard." It's just that your winning and losing has much more to do with luck than good decisions. The hallmark of a good roguelike is that while RNG is there to punish you, multiplying every bad decision, the game's outcome is still mostly in the player's hands.

I know it's early access, but the outcome is NOT mostly in your hands. You can make every good decision in a game of StS, and those decisions, in many runs, have ZERO bearing on the outcome.

Disappointing.

Купил ради интереса и ни разу не пожалел. Что-то подобное уже встречалось, но лишь подобное. Это пожалуй единственный настоящий карточный рогалик на данный момент. Каждый забег мы создаем свою колдоду, постепенно подбираясь к главному боссу, посещая магазины, сражаясь с монстрами и получая за победу над ними новые карты. Однако железный баланс и правило роглайт рандома не позволяет получить именно ту колоду-сборку которую мы хотим, так что тру кки декерам такие правила могут и не понравиться. В игре есть баланс правдо он несколько жесток по отношению к игроку что лично мне не помешало пройти катку с первого раза. Правда я рано радовался, представленная на скринах карта  - это еще ни весь забег. После убийства глав-босса начинается новый забег с более сильными врагами (как я понял не усиленными версиями старых врагоа а именно новыми, но это не точно, играл мало) и в конце еще более сильный глав-босс, требующий в отличие от первого уже нового подхода. 
Описывать все тонкости  нет смысла, лучше самому глянуть, могу лишь сказать что игра ощущается как глоток свежего воздуха: Концепция новая, механика рабочая, тактика в боях присутствует, играть интересно, контента вполне достаточно несмотря что ранний доступ. This is a very polished deck-building game that will be easy to learn even for gamers that haven't ventured into the genre.  I enjoy Hearthstone for its user-friendliness; Slay the Spire has this quality.

I enjoy Star Realms and Dream Quest because those games offer content beyond the "beat your opponent" goal.  Multiple characters and unlocks abound - there's a lot to do here.  I enjoy Binding of Isaac for the multitude of items you can win.  In Slay the Spire these are called relics.  This game is HARD. Today I noticed that the developers have released a patch and I see they are dedicated to improving the game.  I'm looking forward to a bright future with this gem.

36578725.review:
Defeat monsters and build your deck.  The cards are advanced and strategic - at a similar level to the deck building board game "Clank in Space", or we could say halfway to the level of Magic the Gathering.

You choose your way up random maps, choosing routes where you fight normal monsters, hard monsters, more campfire spots to rest or more "?" spots where random events play out (usually something nice, but sometimes bad).  You get new cards for your deck, a choice of 3 each time (or not taking any of them) and have opportunities to kill the occassional weak starting card off.

Currently each character seems to offer several strategic options in how to build your deck, although it would be nice to be able to gradually grind out some starting and "pool" cards (influence the selection of random cards the game picks from).

I would say it is a great start.  The random (?) encounters feel professional, very nice graphics, encounters feel balanced.  Nice gradual unlock system of new cards in the game although I would propose a better alternative:
- Gain coins at end of the adventure.
- Spend coins to purchase random new card/relic unlocks.  Maybe in the form of booster packs somehow, because that feels more exciting/premium to many people.  More clear common/uncommon/rare markings as cards are unlocked for better view of how lucky you were and more like traditional CCG.

In this way it is easier to add new ones during Early Access - they get added to the unlock pile.

Anyhow - definitely recommended.  A top title.

36572724.review:
Very fun and somewhat challenging game. Took me just over 20 runs to beat the current amount of content on the easier of the two current characters available. There are a variety of tactics and ways to defeat the more challenging encounters.

Downsides are that the game is extremely luck dependant. There are ways to cull cards from your deck and alter your draw options for battles, but their appearance is largely dependant upon nothing but your luck. You can remove cards at shops which are visible on the map ahead of time, but only at significant expense.

Similarly the valuable cards and relics that are virtually required to beat the game can only be acquired as random drops from either battles, chests, or shops. You can frequently tell that you have no chance of a successful run before it is halfway complete.

All in all it is very fun and I hope that additional content will improve these issues and expand the content beyond the current 1-2 sessions worth of fun. The price is probably not justified by the current content, but I am hopeful that it will be significantly expanded. I can't recommend the game at its price point in its current state.

The game is difficult, but not impossible. Enemies have different quirks and play styles that you have to memorize through experience. A wide variety of cards and choice events determine your run. Bosses and elites are a challenge but also rewarding. The Deck Building is very fun, you have the option to choose certain cards after an encounter, or just opt not to.

My hope is that there are going to be more than 3 of the current characters that you play as (one still isn't implemented yet), more bosses and monsters to fight, more interesting choice events, and more cards for a wider variety of play style. Otherwise, the game feels very fleshed out and worth the price.

Honestly some of the most fun I've ever had playing a rogue-lite. 9/10

闲来无事意外发现突然有个rougelike卡牌游戏发售了，忍不住就拿过来开始玩，怼了五个小时后的感受如下：

游戏没有中文但实际上并不需要看懂多少英文就能很开心地玩耍

上手很快但难度偏高：1、需要很多计算（伤害，能量之类的）；
                                2、不确定因素多，curse很多，强力道具总会伴随着curse一起出现
                                3、后期敌人很强，一般来说小怪都得打很久

游戏流程以及设定：
1、上次游戏打败任意boss后的下一次游戏开局可以带上某些东西，至于通关后怎么样我就不知道了，毕竟后期我还打不过
2、游戏只有三个关卡，每个关卡均有多条路线，每个路径点可能为怪物、精英怪物、不明事件、商店、篝火、宝箱，不同路线遇到上述事件的数量可能不同（只有宝箱会遇到固定数目），最终一定通向boss，每关有三个boss，随机出现其中之一
3、战斗系统是常见的抽发卡牌形式，但是怪物没有卡牌，每轮行动都会在上一轮玩家回合开始时显示出来，这使得玩家通过周密计算达到胜利成为可能。卡牌池抽完后会将弃牌回炉重来一遍，不过有些卡牌使用后会在本次战斗中消失（下次战斗仍在卡牌池）。而且初始设定每个回合行动完毕玩家会弃掉所有手牌，所以要看仔细怪物的行动再决定自身行为...这种设定还是很有意思的
4、各种道具非常重要，对游戏影响非常大，所以在有把握的情况下要多打精英怪（必掉道具），但金币靠自己取舍买卡牌或道具（有些低品质的其实比高品质实用）
总之我都肝出以撒的感觉了

游戏潜力很大，望尽快丰富游戏内容

36528805.review:
If you're new to this genre: Deckbuilding roguelikes are great. You gain power as you progress up the spire by adding and removing cards from your deck, and then you use your deck to fight monsters, sometimes cycling through all the cards several times in a fight. You can try and build combo decks, once you have played a few times you'll be able to anticipate what cards you might find in shops or as monster loot in future and influence your deck in that way. The monster variety is good and the game is always a challenge.

If you have played Dream Quest / Monster Slayers before: This game is not just a clone. It's new and different. You can have encounters where you fight multiple enemies, you can use consumable items during fights, you manage your resources differently in fights, and the monsters are fairer and have less RNG - you can see what they are going to do on their turn before they do it. I'm not even sure the monsters use a deck of cards to decide what to do. Also navigating the overworld is pretty simple, leaving you to focus on what matters.

Either way, you will enjoy this game.

39424200.review:
[h1]Outstanding rogue-like card game with high replayability![/h1]

Slay the Spire is a dungeon crawling, rogue-like, card game that offers unique challenges in regards to deck building strategy and also the unpredictableness expected in a rogue-like offering.

There are currently two classes; The Ironclad and The Silent. Both classes require different strategies in order to be effective as you progress through the game and while some people will say The Ironclad is the strongest class, there are an equal amount that will argue the exact opposite. 

Both classes have their respective "core" decks at the beginning of each run. The general gameplan revolves around building an optimal deck, while defeating monsters as you progress through the dungeon floors. Defeating a floor gives you the option of choosing 1 of 3 cards (however, you can choose not to take any), gold and possibly a potions. Defeating an elite monster(s) will reward you with a relic that provides some type of enhancement in addition to the regular selection of rewards that are available upon defeating a normal floor. Additional optimizations to your deck can be made throughout the game via the merchant, campfires and random events which are signified by "?"s on the map.

The randomness of what cards are offered and the strategy behind trying to build the most efficient or completely overpowered deck is the main draw to this game and also what provides such replayability. 

Reading through the discussion posts for this game, I've seen a few people say they've "beat the game" their first run, but it honestly isn't the same game every play through. Some times you'll get that key card you've been looking for, and some times you're hanging on by a thread while facing increasingly stonger enemies.

As the game currently stands, it is worth every penny. The developers are actively engaged in updating the game and future additions will only add that much more value to an already amazing product. A third class will be available soon and talks of an "endless mode" in the near future, for example. 

[h1]9/10[/h1]

39423225.review:
Slay the Spire is a excellent rogue-like card-game with a heavy "just one more try"-factor. 
After you chose one of the two available characters (two may sound kinda lackluster, but the complexity of the characters makes up for the lack of quantity), you start with a basic card deck. From there on you start advancing through the dungeon, battle monsters or solve puzzles and collect loot. Whenever you defeat a monster, youll get the choice to add 1 of 3 offered cards to your deck. This is where it gets tricky tho. Without a well crafted deck that follows a specific synergy, there is no hope for you to defeat the final boss - you may not even reach the last floor. So picking the right cards is essential for your sucess - even if this means to skip the reward so your deck doesnt get flooded with cards you dont need. And there are enough monster-battles and shops on the way to the final boss to give you a good chance to craft the deck you aim for, at least most of the time, variance is a thing tho - in the end its still a card-game. You will also obtain relics, which give you passive bonuses - some of which are essential or at least very, very important for specific deck-strategies. But most of the time youll be fine with just crafting a decent deck. And even if you fail your run, youll be able to unlock new potential relics and cards for future runs, so you wont feel like you just wasted your time.

So yeah, the game is pretty good. The combat feels fast paced (which is always nice in card-games), there is already a good amount of potential builds available and the difficulty is rough yet fair enough to keep you trying. Every single character that gets added in the future will offer a whole new set of cards and interactions so there will be even more content. And even in the current EA-state its already a pretty good deal for its price.
And im not even mad after getting screwed by rng :)

Not

mad.

39421642.review:
It's a deck-building rogue-like game, with a very high quality of execution. The game art is quite good, though it's not exactly to my liking - it's a bit cartoony and stylized, I would preferred it to be darker and more gritty, but it's still nice - the animations are very smooth and the interface is clean. Haven't noticed any bugs or lack of polish even though it's in early access.
I play a lot of card games, many of them solo, and deck building is among my favourite genres. The mechanics of this game are very good - lots of customizability and hence room for strategy, lots of variety and interesting ideas. I have to say I do not like that you have to start from the very beginning if you die, but for this game it somehow works and also you have the option to backup your save. Although that's against the spirit of the game, it could be useful for people with less time, so I think it would be nice if you had the option to restart from the beginning of the last zone you reached, instead of the very beginning.
The game is extremely luck dependent - some of the equipment and cards are very powerful and give you a big advantage. And other times you can get devastated in a single turn if you don't draw defensive cards and the enemies pull off their strongest attacks.
I do hope we get a lot more content - heroes, cards, zones, items and enemies, and given the popularity it's gaining, to have more similar games in the future.

39405479.review: This game is one of the most interesting, addicting, beautiful, wonderful, games I have ever played, and it combines so many wonderful elements of so many different genres and styles of game in such an elegant way that I can't really believe that it's not some amalgamation of all the most fun parts of every game I've ever played that I'm experiencing in some extended fucking dream. First of all, the card game aspect - if it were *just* a deckbuilding game, just a paper-and-plastic dungeon crawl - I would own multiple copies and bring it to every party and game night I could. It is so unbelievably fun, and all the cards are so well designed, that it gives things like Dominion, Star Realms, and Ascension a run for their money. What sets Slay the Spire apart from games like Dominion or Star Realms, however, is that it takes the idea of "building a deck" and it puts that in a genre of video game built around the idea of repeatedly progressing and becoming more powerful as one descends into a dungeon. This was probably the reason why the game is so fun, because it means that a) you get to keep playing games with your deck as it gets better and better and b) you don't have to fill your deck with cards that focus on getting other cards like you do in Dominion, Ascension, etc. This allows for the exploration of mechanics like exhaust that would be extraordinarily powerful if they were permanent, like in Ascension, that allow you to improve your deck over the course of the fight without giving you the ability to cheese fights. The game's art is also fucking incredible, although not all of the art is as stellar as the character splash art and the background of the first area (the character art for the Ironclad and the campfire art stand out to me as much uglier than the rest of the game), and it doesn't feel repetitive even after hours upon hours of play. The only negative thing I could possibly say about this game is that I want - I need - more of it, more relics, more cards, more archetypes, more events, more enemies, more potions, more everything. There's so much possibility here, and I cannot fucking wait to see what Mega Crit does with this new format of game they've created.

This game is so addictive.  When I first saw it, I thought Darkest Dungeon meets Card Hunter (both games I can waste days playing) and I was right.  The game is a blast and after the first twelve hours, I still can't wait to get home from work so that I can try a new strategy or a different approach.  The card building part of the game lets you experiment with different builds and forces you to get creative at times.  The random relics and card drops add a replayability that has kept me glued to the computer since I bought the game.  I also found the variation in the enemies, and especially the boss fights, to keep me interested and on my toes.

Best $15 I've spent on a video game ever.

39404549.review: This game is amazing. It is a randomized deck-builder, in the vein of tabletop games such as Dominon, Ascension, and Clank. It also incorperates a random relic system ala Risk of Rain or Binding of Issac. You build your deck as you choose your path through the Spire, collecting cards and relics and gold along the way. Currently there are 2 classes, with very different decks and play styles. Because of the randomness involved, this game can be hard, but if you enjoy planning on the fly and having said carefully laid plans of a pathway through a level change because of a relic you got, this game is for you. I cannot reccomend it enough.

39404402.review: So I would have never thought in a million years that I would play, let alone enjoy, a card game. I'm a big fan of games like The binding of isaac, Enter the Gungeon, etc and that is what Slay the Spire feels like to me. You start off with 1 character and there are levels/floors you must clear and you can gain items that give abilities (relics) and new Cards to add to your deck. So even if you aren't much of a card game player, and like the games I mentioned above, I would definitely reccomend trying this out.

39398635.review:
==To the Mega-Crit Devs==
Great game!  I will continue to enjoy it over development, and I hope you don't rebalance things [i]too hard[/i] as I think the both characters are strong and balanced.
Idea for character #3, I hope you'll stay away from making another "juggernaut" style class that starts combat weak and goes supersaiyan around turn 5 - you already have two via Iron's strength-building, and Silence's Block/Poison-building.  I'd like to see a "caster" class that can Stun/Disarm/Silence/CC and punish enemies based on their intentions, add some damage reflect/thorns.  Consider having a glass-cannon high-risk/high reward style, maybe start combat with vulnerability but deal tons of extra damage.  Right now turtling on either character is the surest way to beat the game... but it's boring.

==REVIEW==
Love it, it's the best game in its style since Darkest Dungeon was first in EA (not the current abomination). Imagine walking into an 80's arcade and seeing a black machine in the corner, it takes one quarter and you get no extra lives, no continues.  

 It has a similar dark theme to DD with a smatter of Magic the Gathering, and fans of either will enjoy StS.  

My biggest gripe in Darkest Dungeon was that there was such much unfair and un-fun RNG... Spire's RNG comes from getting lucky with relics and events/merchants. Yet without the random strings of party-wide crits, Spire remains difficult. 

I love the fact that games last roughly 45-90 minutes, as an older gamer with a kid this is all the time I can get in a single sitting, so I love being able to finish a game, it reminds me of gauntlet/arcade style tabletop games.  This is one I actually look forward to playing with my kids, even 10 years from now.

39395618.review:
C'est un peu difficile d'évaluer ce jeu parce qu'il est est exactement ce qu'il annonce, un jeu de carte solo rogue-like, avec tout ce que cela implique d'aléatoire dans le gameplay. Et cela peut ne pas plaire à tout le monde...

Il faut de plus préciser que la construction du deck ne se fait pas au préalable mais au fur et à mesure. En effet, à chaque combat remporté, vous gagnez de l'or, parfois une potion et le droit de choisir une carte parmi 3. Vous pouvez aussi acheter ces cartes en payant si vous croisez un marchand. La construction du deck se fait donc en s'adaptant aux cartes que vous rencontrez et parfois, c'est très compliqué de créer quelque chose qui marche fâce aux enemis qu'on croise de façon tout aussi aléatoire. C'est très intéressant mais parfois frustrant à cause de l'aspect rogue-like qui vous oblige à tout recommencer si la rencontre se passe mal. Mais bon, on a été prévenu à l'achat. 

Enfin, sachez que vous partez avec un pool de points de vie pour l'aventure et que tant que vous n'avez pas remporté la bataille contre le boss de niveau, ces points ne se reconstituent que sous conditions strictes : avoir une relique spéciale, camper, avoir des cartes (rares) qui rendent des pv. 


Pour l'instant deux classes sont proposées : le tank et l'assassin, très différents à jouer, avec leur propre set de cartes. 
Graphiquement, l'ambiance est très sympathique avec un style singulier et soigné. L'animation est banale. 
Un jeu tout à fait correct pour le prix donc, même si certains joueurs prétendent avoir fini en moins de 6h, c'est à dire en gros au deuxième run.

39395374.review:
얼리엑세스, 적은 볼륨에도 불구하고 굉장히 재미있는 로그라이크 카드 게임.

pros
-싼 가격
-재밋음

cons
-얼리엑세스
-컨텐츠가 정말 적음
-밸런스 개선의 여지가 있음

요약

카드 게임이나 로그라이크를 좋아한다면 반드시 해봐야할 게임
개발진행이 기대되는 얼리엑세스 게임

-----------------------------------

로그라이크를 컨셉으로하는 게임도 많았고, 카드를 컨셉으로 하는 게임들도 많았지만, 컨셉을 진정 게임성으로 승화시킨 게임들은 많지 않았다.

로그라이크, TCG, 모두 힙한 소재였을 뿐이지 이를 제대로 이해하는 개발자는 많지 않기 때문이다.

하지만 이 게임은 그 두가지 컨셉을 게임성으로 승화시켰을 뿐만 아니라, 두가지를 완벽하게 조화하는 데도 성공했다.

여러 게임에서 검증된 요소들을 적절하게 차용했고, 모든 요소들이 완벽하게 어우러진다.

이게임은 로그라이크로서도 재밋고, 카드 게임으로서도 재밋다.


그렇다고 해서 완벽한 게임은 아니다.

전체적인 게임 진행이 경직돼 있기 때문에, 덱 선택의 자유성은 굉장히 떨어진다.

회복 수단은 제한적이고, 적들은 턴이 길어질수록 버프를 무한히 쌓는 종류가 대부분이며, 체력의 1/4에 달하는 엄청난 데미지를 한턴에 가하기 때문에

플레이어는 결국 덱 빌딩에 있어서 방어력을 쌓아 데미지 입는 것을 원천 차단하거나, 최대한 빠르게 적을 죽이는 두가지 스타일의 선택지만을 가진다.

게임은 노골적으로 특정 컨셉의 덱을 제공하지만, 그 컨셉덱들 조차 결국 저 두가지 스타일의 범주 내에 있다.

게다가 이 게임은 로그라이크다. 만약 하스스톤이었다면 많이 지더라도 단 한판의 승리를 위한 멋진 컨셉덱이 가능할테지만, 로그라이크적 특성이 그런 것을 허용하지 않는다.

단 한판의 승리는 커녕 당신은 덱을 완성하기도 전에 죽게 될 것이다.


덱을 빌딩하는 방법에 대해서도 개선의 여지가 있다.

안그래도 운7 기3의 카드게임인 전투를 가진 게임에, 그 덱을 빌딩하는 것 마저도 순전히 운으로만 결정 되기 때문에 이게임은 운의 비중이 너무 크다.

덱 빌딩 수단의 밸런스 또한 너무 새로운 카드를 추가하는 것만 쉽게 되있다. 쓸모 없는 카드를 지우는 것이 너무 어렵다.

카드 시스템의 특성상 덱은 카드의 장수가 적으면 적을 수록 강하지만, 쓰레기 같은 기본 카드 10장이 자리를 차지하고 있고, 이를 제거하는 것은 너무나도 어렵다.

카드를 전부 사용하면 사용한 카드가 다시 덱으로 돌아와 드로우 되는 시스템 상에서 굳이 기본 공격, 기본 방어 카드를 10장 씩이나 줄 이유가 있는지가 의문이다.

---------------------------------------------------

39391853.review:
This game is an absolutely delicious jewel, hitting the sweet spot in so many way. 
I'll be honest; I'm hooked.

It's a deep and juicy deck-building game where every decision you make is difficult, important and satisfying. It has enough interacting systems to be clever, but never overwhelming. Enough randomness to be challenging and dangerous, but never really unfair. Enough information that you can make informed choices, but never enough to let you relax. Enough variety to make each step in the game feel new and unknown, but never to feel like you're lost.

Each play-through has a linear progression - you must travel onwards up the Spire with each step, to harder and riskier encounters, until you reach the final boss. The goal then is for your power curve to outpace the game's, and that means balancing short-term survival against long-term goals at each step. A full game (if you survive) can be up to about 2hrs if you take it steady, and is divided into three distinct sections with a boss at the end of each, so it's a treat to pick up & put down without burning out.

And while the larger game is a strategic risk/reward landscape that you have to navigate and reassess as you go, each hand is like a puzzle, where the right plays in the right order will maximise your deck's utility and give you the edge.

There is enough depth to the mechanics that you'll very quickly discover a number of synergies between the properties of the cards you can collect, and the bonuses you get from special Relics. After ten hours or so, I feel like I understand the game inside out, but I'm a long way from mastering it, or even seeing half of it. There are only two playable characters in the Early Access build, each with their own set of cards, unlocks and unique play-styles, and while I look forward to the developers adding more, what's there is already deeply satisfying.

And the polish is immaculate. Apart from the great art, animation & sound, the UI is clean, clear and gorgeous, and you're never more than a single click away from any information you might need. The developers have clearly done everything possible to make sure that no matter how challenging or cruel your play session might sometimes get, you never feel like the game *itself* is screwing you, deliberately or through poor design. You might groan sometimes, but you'll never rage-quit.

That's quite enough from me. If any of the elements in this game sound like they're your kind of thing, then rest assured it has been executed masterfully here. Even if it were never to reach full release, this is a game I will play for a very long time.

39387801.review:
非常棒的游戏

画面在卡牌游戏里算是一流的了，bgm也很赞

机制类似dbg，除了牌库构建是在战斗之外，玩过领土的应该很容易理解。

dbg也算是个桌游的大机制了，领土火了以后，不少人都开发dbg这个机制或者尝试将其与其他机制混搭，本作可以说是dbg与roguelike混搭的非常成功的一作。
跟普通卡牌游戏的一大区别就是加入了遗物的概念（类似其他roguelike里的道具），可以说提供了除卡组以外的另一个维度，在游戏中组出遗物和卡组的混合combo也是非常有成就感。

这里提一下炉石传说狗头人版本的冒险模式，那里面有一种宝藏牌，被动的宝藏牌就类似本游戏的遗物（主动宝藏牌只是单纯的强卡）。
而slay the spire的遗物比起炉石的宝藏牌感觉重要性更高，多样性也更丰富。
也就是说roguelike的成分更强烈，是向roguelike方向迈出的更大的一步。

顺便说一下炉石的冒险模式的设计师之前还出过一个挺有名的卡牌游戏叫dream quest，与slay the spire有些类似。
但是我个人更喜欢这个游戏，因为比起dream quest这个游戏不那么变态，玩起来基本不需要看脸，不像dream quest有些针对的怪刻意卡的你难受的不行或者初见绝对过不了。
这游戏难度就适中，玩起来很顺畅，很爽，基本停不下来。
虽然古典rogue游戏都是以硬核为主，但要知道卡牌游戏很大一个爽点就是说书，自己辛苦组出来的卡组boss说一句什么话就不能出牌了 这感觉非常不好。

所以说本游戏在卡牌游戏和rogue游戏中的平衡做的很好，两个机制的爽点形成一种叠加的关系。而且难度设置也比较合理（或者说稍微偏简单一点，但现在才前三关）

说了半天主要就是这游戏一个很大的优点：流畅性很强，不别扭

至于耐玩度的话，不一定能玩几百个小时，但是如果官方一直更新，那还是相当可玩的。毕竟单机游戏玩几十个小时也赚了。不多说了，快去买买买

39386003.review:
Slay the Spire is the love child of Hearthstone, FTL, Darkest Dungeon and Armello.
A simple yet elegant deckbuilder combined with the difficulty and randomness of a rouguelike dungeon crawler.

I am in love with how frustrating and hard this game is because everytime you restart, it's back to square one with crafting a new deck/playstyle. It is as if the developers wanted you to learn by failing over and over. With that said, I feel as if some playthroughs I am severely struggling or just straight gunning it and mowing down everybody. I guess maybe some mobs or instances may need some balancing or it's purely RNGesus. 

The game is still in Early Access, and I hope the developers continue to keep up the good work.

39382091.review:
** EARLY ACCESS ** 

Slay the Spire is a well crafted, and engaging deck-building game which deftly combines Dominion or Ascension from the boardgame world with the unique capabilities of a rogue-lite video game. 

The core principle is simple, you pick one of two currently available classes (a tank/warrior and rogue class would be the simplest analog to other games), which gifts you with a small deck made up of 2 class-specific cards and a base-set of core defense and attack cards. 

You face a randomly generated map made up of normal and elite battles, surprises, sanctuaries, treasure, shops and bosses. You select your own path, either taking on additional risk for higher chances of rewards, or comparatively safe paths. 

The basic, well-tested game design theories are well utilized, and it shows as you can use highly varied strategies in your attempt to draft and build the best available deck. Permanent items called Relics offer synergy-based guidance, enemies attack one-dimensional decks, and each turn can take on the feel of a complex puzzle as you try to block incoming damage, overcome vulnerabilities and afflictions, and kill the enemies before they overwhelm you. 

The look of the game is cohesive, and has a nice asthetic, even though it is generally speaking rather simplistic.

The game is hard. Not punishingly so, however. You learn enemies so you can more successfully counter them, you learn how cards work together and how to balance your progression through the game. 

Even in Early Access this game is worth its price tag and the developers are attentive and aggressive patching, offering hope that the final release will deliver on the potential and promise of an already compelling and well-executed game. 

Early Access Rating: 7.5/10

39381870.review:
스타렐름즈나 어센션 같은 덱빌딩 게임에 로그라이크 진행 방식이 들어간 게임입니다.

단, 덱빌딩이라고 해도 실제 보드게임에서 자주 접할 수 있는 내 턴이 되면 핸드를 거의 대부분 털어가며 새 카드를 어떤걸 보강할까 고민하는 타입의 덱 빌딩이 아니고 한번 한번의 전투 종료 때 마다 덱을 보강하기는 하지만 게임 자체가 덱 빌딩으로 이루어지지는 않습니다. 손에 들어온 카드 사용에 초점이 있다보니 사실은 덱 빌딩 게임이라기 보다는 전술적인 카드 사용이 중요한 타입의 게임입니다.

로그라이크 + 덱 빌딩이라면 ios 용 드림 퀘스트가 가장 유명하겠지만, 이 게임은 한정된 자원을 가지고 적들의 타입에 따라 콤보를 짜거나 하는 방식이다 보니 거의 아무도 모르는 게임인 Panoptes 에 더 가깝습니다.

단, 드림퀘스트나 판옵테스보다 더 직관적이면서도 잘 정비되어 있으며 적의 다음 행동을 보여줌으로 선택지를 계속 다르게 결정해야 하는 등의 훌륭한 터치로 스킬을 직접 선택하는 스타일의 게임에 있어 매우 훌륭한 모습을 보여줍니다.

로그라이크로 갖춰야 할 것들(적응과 반응이 필요한 난수적인 환경, 그럼에도 불구하고 횟수를 거듭하면 실력이 나아지는 구조)을 거의 모두 훌륭하게 갖춘 게임이므로 당연히 추천합니다만, 덱빌딩이라는 이름에 혹하시는 경우는 조금 주의하시기 바랍니다.

39381460.review:
A Rogue-like card game.
You start off by picking one hero (3 in total but only 2 are playable atm in early access) each hero has his own cards and buffs.
You start with 1 buff and a couple of cards.
As you progress through the game you get more buffs,cards and potions.
It´s really fun to build different decks, try different strategies and see how far you can get.
If you die your run is over (wich is obv. because it`s a Rogue-like : ))
But after every run you unlock more cool stuff buffs/cards etc.
Every round feels fresh and you just wanna keep playing.

If you like Rogue-likes or card games you should really check this game out.

It´s an Early Access game but there is enough content and no crashes or other issues.

10/10 worth the price imo.

Although there are some bugs with the game (given it's in early access), the devs are very friendly and are willing to help you through any problems that you're experiencing. I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys strategy games or rougelikes.

39378786.review:
中文名 《屠戮尖塔》。

zard说要ban几个游戏，结果一玩就是四个小时，我也围观了四个小时，然后果断入正。

游戏不大，操作简单，画面尚可，但是游戏性完爆《命运之手》。

三个小时战士通关，说说我的一点体会：

1，千万不要随便拿卡，相反，基础卡能扔就扔。因为牌堆是循环利用的，废牌太多你就刷不出核心牌。
2，看自己的血量和牌库，选好路线。记得升级卡牌，有的牌升级前升级后简直就是两个量级。
3，每次失败都要总结， 怪物每回合干什么都是有套路的，计算好伤害和格挡，该喝药水就喝起来。

我走的是防战套路，但是并没有拿到格挡不消失的“壁垒”和加20格挡这两张核心牌，即使如此，第三关BOSS没能打掉我一滴血。反倒是被我格挡+反伤+消耗+反伤给反死了。

策略和运气同等重要。

39378677.review: This is the first game I have ever reviewed and I believe is actually warranted one. I do not enjoy roguelikes and I don't play card games;however, this game is probably one of the best games I've played in a few years. It's not ridiculously punishing, as most of the problems you'll encounter in the run are due to your own fault instead of complete random chance. The characters are actually different characters and not re-skins and the amount of ways to play/build either of the two currently released is amazing high. It's a fantastic game and it has a developer who not only communicates with the public but also has BI-WEEKLY updates. The game isn't slow and doesn't take long for it to flesh itself out for a big payoff; from the start, every action feels like it's its own payoff. If you aren't a fan of roguelikes or card games, the game differs enough between both of them that it's almost in its own genre and can be played by people who hate both. Play it for an hour and then realize I'm right and that this game is amazing.

39375867.review:
I recommend this game IF you are willing to invest into an early accsess project. There is verry little content at the moment (beat it after 3h getting the perfect achievement on the 3rd boss) but the game will hopefully grow. 

I do recommend this game especially if you are already a fan of solo adventure card games. It implements the mechanics typically found in theses games fairly well but takes care off all the bookeeping, setting up etc.
At the moment it has two different character classes with their own playstyles. Both of theses characters have each two more or less viable types of decks you can build.  A third class is in the making.
You start with a deck of basic cards and make your way through what is basically a gameboard where you fight minons, find new cards, gold, relics, upgrade cards, rest, get rid of weaker or curse cards etc. Everything fairly basic but solid. At the end of each of the currently three boards you fight one of a handfull bosses with different mechanics. But most of the time you do not have to adapt to their strategy and rather just use the strategy your deck is build around. In true rougelike fashion ( but not uncommon in adventure card games) once you die you have to start from the beginning and might unlock some minor cards and relics.

The core is similar to the usual adventure card game decks where you try to get a draw and in this case energy engine going, upgrade cards and get rid of weaker cards. This trusted formula is in this game as fun as in most other adventure card games. The synergies between cards is mostly obvious and I would like to have a bit more variety when it comes to deck building. The best choices for cards/upgrades/relics is most of the time pretty obvious.

The Artwork for the characters, backgrounds and enemies is quite nice, the enemies are mostly good looking and their attacks have appropriate tells. The board on the other hand is rather basic and the artwork on the cards get's the job done but it could be better in my opinion.

It is alot of fun but at the moment there just isn't alot of content. Especially for a Rougelike it is incredible fast to beat. Maybe another difficulty option would be a nice addition.

It would be amazing to integrate a hot seat mode, to play together with a friend to enjoy basically an adventure card game (instead of a solo adventure card game). This would also give ample opportunity to introduce more depth with the decks of players synergising.

All in all if you like Adventure Card games and don't mind to invest into a project that will hopefully grow to be something awesesome you should get it. Otherwise I would wait to see how it turns out and how much content is actually added before release. Anyways I highly recommend watching a bit of a let's play or stream to get a good feeling for the game!

tldr if you like tcgs/deckbuilders and roguelikes buy this game now (but remember it's early access)

This is just a fantastic game. I was hesitant to play it because I've played a lot of card games over my life so my expectations were really high. The concept sounded cool but the more I thought about the execution of that concept the more skeptical I was that it could be pulled off. But man oh man did it succeed. The character classes are evocative and really give you a different experience. There are very few cards in either set that aren't worth playing so every time you add a new card to the deck it's a tough decision. Combat is really intuitive, fun, and the enemies present a diverse group of challenges.

That being said the game is still in early access. In six hours of play time I didn't run across a single bug, but the content is scarce. There's only three levels to the spire and only two characters.  None of this will impact your runs until you get past that point though so it's still worth picking up to play the beginning of what is bound to be a truly excellent game.

39372766.review:
In this "Darkest Dungeon" meets "Hearthstone Arena" style card game, "Slay the Spire" exceeds all expectations of a Dungeon Crawler and the game is still extremely unfinished looking. 

Absolutely incredible title despite looking equally as bare-boned. It speaks volumes when a game has so little visual appeal and can hold my attention for over 6-8 hours without alt-tabbing once. Then realizing I had spent my entire Sunday playing a card-game of all things, says so much about the positive direction this game is going in.

As someone who hates card games(Hearthstone being #1), deck metas, randomness, and is more than frequently destroyed by the unforgiving deity entity known as RNGesus, "Slay the Spire" is one of the most fun card games I have ever played.

Just like "Darkest Dungeon" you are thrown into a dungeon with multiple rooms that ultimately leads to the boss at the end. As you complete rooms, many things can happen both good and bad, you can;

1. Add a random card to your deck out of a small selection of 3 occasionally getting an upgraded '+' card, or rare, or even epic card(after battles only)
2. Find a relic that grants some form of perk or debuff or both.
3. Shop to purchase potions, relic's exclusive to the shop, 'colorless' cards almost all of which are insanely useful like Apotheosis(insanely powerful, possibly even broken card that upgrades your entire deck for that battle) and  Enlightenment(another insanely powerful card that costs nothing to use, and reduces all card costs to 1 for that turn)
4. Encounter an event that has choices that are often risk and/or/then reward.
5. Rest.
6. Encounter elite mobs.

Although there's no guarentee the game will screw you over once in a while with its randomness, but even then sometimes it isn't too bad as the excitement of starting over and potentially having a better run than before is enough to tide over the expectation of failure from RNG.

The battle-system is essentially like Hearthstone, where you have 'X' amount of mana(Energy as it's called in this) to cast spells, attacks, abilities or block, but you do not gain Energy with passing turns, you have to find relics, or spells that increase your total Energy.

The game currently only has 2 characters, but I'm excited to see more and more from this game, and hoping it doesn't simply stop at 3 characters and 3 floors. This game has an incredible amount of attention and hope to see it ported to handheld just like Darkest Dungeon, would definitely purchase a copy as this game is an amazing time burner.

39372216.review:
This game is really well put together.
It has a nice art style,
a refreshing amount of depth,
and an addicting concept.

But it's also not perfect.
-It has a painfully low amount of attack animation.
-there are only two characters you get to play as (though they're adding another one).
-Its not easy to make your character play a certain stratagy, (like a poison run, or a block brute run) because of how you obtain cards and relics; you just kind of have to hope you get poison cards for example if you want to do a poison run.
-you always start with the same cards. This one is just a personal prefrence though, I just wish I could design a starting deck so it could fit a specific play style.

Overall, this is a really fun game. If you like Rouge-Likes or Card Based Games, then I really recommend playing it, especially if it's on sale.

7/10 - *vERy NICe*

39353173.review:
So... I just beat it. In 2 hours. 
I love TCG and I also enjoy roguelike elements. But these two have two very different elements that kind of fail to work together right now:
- In TCG you often experience happiness by creating a better and better deck which you then can use and save/keep improving.
- In roguelike, you face a really big challenge which is also very punishing if you fail (lose all progress) but creates an amazing feeling when you do succeed.

What does this game give you? Well, none of the above. You can beat the game in 2 hours (if you are a good player) = the roguelike challenge isn't quite there and you gotta start over after every run (even successful ones) you make = the "feeling good experience" from a deck building element of a constructed TCG isn't there either. 

For those who have played Magic the gathering: it is kind of like drafting all the time. You start with a very weak pre-set deck which you then may choose to add 1 card out 3 after every enemy encounter, with very limited ways of removing cards from the deck. You may also get potions and relics that boosts your deck in random ways.

This game did not really do it for me in its current state but it may evolve in the future since it is only in EA right now. Going for a refund for now.

39342821.review:
NL ruined my life
TL;DR - "One More Turn" simulator 2018

For real though, this game is amazing - if you love difficult, if occasionally frustrating roguelite card games then this is probably the best one you'll find.
My only criticism so far is that The Silent feels a lot more powerful than The Ironclad, but obviously this is still early access and I suck.
Right now I'm having a blast trying out a bunch of synergies and archetypes, and there really are a lot of those to try: my only win so far consisted of a confusion/exhaust build with The Silent using Snecko Eye and picking the most expenisve cards I could find, but even the runs I don't win with end up teaching me what not to do next turn as well as unlocking new cards and relics.

This game is a solid 9/10 IMO, and I can't wait to see where it ends up.

39341861.review:
I usually don't purchase EA games since most of the times it's a gamble that leads to disappointment.
In this case though I HIGHLY recommend you to give Slay the Spire a try!
It's a Roguelike game with constant unlocks and improvements for each playthrough you carry over to the following one, in which you play an adventurer who was to climb a spire and defeat many bosses to achieve his goal. The combat system is impressively fluid and no playthrough is the same as your previous one, due to many random factors tossed in from floors layouts to deck compositions. Yes, because the fighting experience is through card decks, a very interesting touch to the game that makes it stand out from the rest.
And for 15€ price it's definitely a good investment for many hours of fun

39341229.review:
An absolutely perfect blend of some of my favorite things, CCG, Roguelike and a turn based combat system, "Slay the Spire", is an addictive CCG in which you traverse a tower in the same manner you would in "FTL", along the way you will gain items, relics and other cards that will help you on your way to the top of the tower, where there are bosses. All of this wrapped in an absolutely amazing art style. 

For an early access title and at the current price it's worth every penny (and some more).

Slay the Spire is an excellent example of early release done right, do yourself a favor and just play it.

39340442.review:
This is my first review.  I like the game so much I felt like writing one. 

For an Early Access game, Slay the Spire is already very well fleshed out and feels complete insofar as the content it provides.  The two classes you get to play with already feel finished and well-balanced.  I would strongly recommend this game to people who like deck-building games and/or rogue likes.  

Some quality of life things I would like to see added to the game:

1.  Option: When facing only one enemy, you don't have to target that enemy when playing an attack.  (This is something that would speed up pace of play a little, but would make a huge difference in time saved overall)
2.  Option: One-click card play for skills and powers.  (For people who have played a lot, decision making comes quickly and the only thing keeping me from playing super fast is having to click and drag cards.)
3.  Option: A warning for when you are leaving an item or card behind.  Sometimes playing fast makes me breeze through a selection without actually picking up a relic.

I'm very excited to see what else this game has in store.

首先，游戏是个好游戏，我也通关了，死了不少次，走的力量流，叠了整整64力，一堆强化牌连锁爆发了好几回合。
感觉战士比刺客强不少，格挡流和力量流都摸清了就很顺，可能是我错觉或脸黑，刺客毒流的核心牌摸不到，小刀流也摸不到核心爆发。这些其实也无所谓
但是我为啥给了差评呢，明明都承认是好游戏
主要还是要提点问题差评更醒目吧

首先，这个游戏是个讲策略搭配的打牌游戏吧
既然是要用点脑子的
那么就不应该有那些可以无脑通关的卡
说的就是你，旋风斩
这个游戏加活力的手段太多，真的太多。遗物加，卡牌加。到第三关之前，一回合4活一点都不难。就算没有常驻，用卡牌加活力打一回合的爆发，也不难吧。
旋风斩，真的太强了。配合双发这种真的太无脑。第三关的boss都能杀过。这个套路卡牌核心需求少。在这种情况下，其他套路的核心牌是它的起码两倍
还有神化，0费还方便简直了，就是不好得到，还在商店里，因此还能说得过去。可是旋风斩这种东西，小怪都掉，真的...太容易得又太强了

39339022.review:
玩出套路以后就觉得有点无聊啦……

[list]
  [*] 攻击：
      [list]
        [*] 战士堆力量，比如观察弱点、燃烧、活动肌肉等等，再加重刃可以打出很高的瞬发伤害
        [*] 猎人堆毒，关键牌是弹跳毒瓶，有催化剂更好，毒雾等只起辅助作用
        [*] 辅助效果上，带多层易伤的牌要留一些，只是猎人不一定用得到。战士的钢笔是神器。
      [/list]
  [*] 防御：
      [list]
        [*] 保证一定的护甲，比如有足够多的护甲牌和能量保证瞬发值；或者战士的堡垒/猎人的残影递延护甲
        [*] 过牌非常重要，抽得越多越好，比如骰子、进化+、忘记名字的限制抽卡的某零费牌等等，牌的周转速度越高能保证你在一轮内可以打出想要的效果，同时有效抵抗牌组污染。
        [*] 反伤可有可无，前期有用后期鸡肋。伤害太少。特别是一众无法叠加伤害或没有辅助效果的牌，没有拿的必要。
        [*] 谁有能量谁是爹，向日葵很好，如果拿到冰淇淋……可以随便打了。肾上腺素、祭品等拿牌且加能量的都是极品牌。特别是子弹时间，有这个加上足量过牌想不通关都难。
        [*] 其他辅助效果，虚弱是必备了，给对手减力量的也挺不错，比如猎人的尖啸，关键时刻可以保命。
      [/list]
[/list]

不过我也没完全解锁所有牌，可能还有别的吧，但大致思路很清晰，就是堆高伤并保证护甲够用。也可能有疯狂堆护甲和反甲等效果慢慢磨的，我是没这耐心了= =

39333663.review:
This game is something else. Something I never knew I wanted to play. A combination I never knew could work so good.  Slay the Spire is a dynamic deck-building rogue-lite. I know, it does sound a little odd but bear with me. The game is progressed as your standart rogue-lite, you go from room to room collecting items, batteling enemies, having special encounters, but in Slay the Spire, you also collect cards, that you can use in your future encounters. Its almost like your everyday average rogue-lite, but the combat mechanics are a gamechanger here. 
The game starts with you staring at a map and trying to figure out where to go. Your goal is to move up the spire until you reach the top, and then go to the next big level. 
The combat is crafted masterfully and yet it is so simple. You open the combat with a hand, that is drawn from your deck of cards and you start your move. 
Relics can be obtained from a variety of sources. You are guaranteed to pick up 1 per floor in an item chest, you can get one (or more with some items) from elite monsters, you will always get one from a floor boss and you can obtain some at the question mark encounters
And that's about it. That is the game. Simple right? Yet it is so addicting. The artwork on the cards is great, the enemy design is interesting and silly sometimes, and the music feels almost ambient. The game puts you in a state of relaxation, yet it is so thrilling and you can lose hours of your day playing it.

39318894.review:
This is more of a heads up than a review. You've probably seen all of the other positive feedback for the game, and I agree for the most part. However, I'd like to make aware that the "replay value" the game contains is rather limited in my opionion.

There is no longstanding progression in the game. Once you complete a run (which takes an hour or two), you have to restart from square one. There is no point to the game other than enjoying your playtime, which is fine if restarting from scratch every few hours is your thing. Personally, I would much rather an endless mode of play, which was what I expected.

This is a good game, and it's worth the odd 15-20$. However, being forced to restart after a few hours of play really killed it for me. The game's still in early access, and hopefully in the future we can get some longer game modes, or out-of-run progression.

39309529.review: 游戏模式十分类似于Dream Quest和月圆之夜这种。需要不停地选择卡牌来建立牌组战斗。刚开始会十分困难，对于我这种刚玩一个小时的玩家，勉勉强强用第二个人物能打到第三章。遗物的加强还是很有用的，除了基础的构筑，运气也是十分重要的一部分，而且不像月圆之夜可以轻松简单的消除卡牌，这里面的基础牌能力十分弱还要花费很多金币来进行消除，或者购买净化这种卡进行消除，抽牌卡给我感觉很多的样子，以往的类似游戏中过牌往往成为构筑中很重要的部分，但在这个游戏中，由于出牌存在能量限制，往往你过很多牌也没有出几张的机会。。不过过牌还是能提高拿到核心卡的几率。。此外依靠升级解锁新卡，很多核心卡都需要解锁。。刚玩没多久的萌新感觉这游戏还是需要挺多时间的。。喜欢这种模式的小伙伴还是不要错过。总的来说很好玩的一款游戏。。

39309258.review:
대부분의 게이머가 보고 불안해하는 두 가지 요소를 (얼리액세스, 로그라이크) 모두 포함하고 있는 게임인 슬레이 더 스파이어.
요 리뷰엔 대부분의 게이머가 보고 지나치는 얼리 액세스 설띵들도 짚고 넘어가고자 함.

데XX같은 얼리 게임과 다르게 쓰여져 있는 것 처럼 약속을 잘 지키고 있고, 제작진이 자랑스럽게 설명하는 것 처럼 (best single player deckbuilde)  잘 짜기만 한다면 옆 동네 미라클 도적마냥 화려하게 사기치는 플레이 가능해 매 전투마다 큰 재미를 보장함.

전투 방식은 동영상과 게임 스크린샷에서 볼 수 있듯이, 타 T,CCG 처럼 매턴 리필되는 에너지로 특정 코스트의 공격,방어,파워 등의 카드들을 사용해 진행해나가는 방식. 겸사 겸사 포션도 던지고 유물도 획득하고 상점도 들리고.


옆 동네 약간 어두운 게임처럼 상상만 해도 너무 행복해서 경련 일어나는 다이스 굴리기로 인한 데미지 및 명중 편차가 존재하지 않아 비교적 덜 스트레스 받으며 플레이가 가능한것도 하나의 장점이라 생각함. 

이걸 나쁘게 말하면 '내가 뭘 해도 죽어버리는 각이 보인다' 인데, 
이건 카드 게임 특유의 다이스라 할 수 있는 갓드로우로 해결될 수도 안될 수도 있습니다.
랜덤 인카운터도 존재해 로그라이크건 라이트건, 제일 큰 장점인 운빨졷망겜에선 벗어날 수 없음. 그게 재미를 창출하는 거지만.


게임 설명은 여기서 마치고, 대부분의 게이머가 안보고 지나치는 얼리액세스 일정에 대해 대충 쓰도록 함.

제작진들이 말하길, 얼리 액세스 상태로 최소 4개월, 최대 8개월까지 진행한다 하고, 대략 2주마다 유저들의 피드백을 수렴해서 업데이트 한다고 했음. 현재까지 총 7번의 업데이트가 진행되었으니 위에 적은 것 처럼 몇몇 폐급 얼리 게임들마냥 약속 안지키고 질질 끄는 경우는 안 생기리라 생각함.

정식버전에 추가되는 컨텐츠로는.

다른 카드 덱을 사용하는 새로운 캐릭터와 개선된 컨텐츠들.
리더보드. 일일 도전같은 소셜 기능들은 후에 추가 할 예정.

현재 체험 가능한 얼리 액세스 컨텐츠는.

고유한 카드덱을 사용하는 두명의 캐릭터. ( 간단하게 설명하면 전사와 도적 )
최대 200장의 카드들 / 50개 이상의 전투 인카운터.
각각 다른 9명의 보스 / 100개 이상의 아이템들.

제작진들은 현 단계에서 모든 컨텐츠를 체험하는데 15~30시간이 걸릴거라 예상하고 있고. ( 모든 카드 해금 말하는 것 같음. )
얼리 액세스가 끝나고 정식 버전으로 들어서면 가격이 오를 예정. 구체적인 가격은 명시하지 않았으나 현재 게임 가격을 생각해 봤을 때 20달러 초중반이 되지 않을까 싶음.

아무튼 간만에 정말 재밌게 즐길 수 있었던 얼리액세스 게임.

Seit Mitte November 2017 veröffentlichte Studio: Megacrit sein Erstlingswerk Slay The Spire im Early Access auf Steam. Die unabhängigen Entwickler aus Seattle wollen nicht weniger, als die Grundmechaniken von Roguelikes, Trading-Card Spielen, Dungeon Crawler und Pen & Paper miteinander verbinden und haben meiner Meinung nach gute Chancen das Umzusetzen.

Grafisch nicht hübsch, aber dienlich macht das Spiel mir ein heidenspaß und ich hoffe die Entwickler werden ihre Ziele auch weiter so umsetzen.

Ein Angespielt und blöde Kommentiert Video ist in meinem Kanal zu finden wer mehr sehen will: 
https://youtu.be/arjjMC0P2ZU

Die Early-Access-Version umfasst soweit ich weiß:
• 2 Hauptcharaktere
• über 200 Karten
• über 50 einzigarteige Kämpfe
• über 100 verschiedene Gegenstände
• prozedural generierte Levels
• freischaltbare Gegenstände

도적으로 첫 앤딩을 봤는데 그 감격이 어지간한 메인스트림급 타이틀 그 이상이였어요.
오히려 엔딩이 미묘한 게임보다 스스로 성취감을 발끝에서부터 느껴볼 수 있는 이런 게임이 좋다고 생각합니다.
도전하는걸 좋아하고, 극복하는걸 좋아한다면 정말정말 강력하게 추천해드리는 작품입니다.

39290676.review:
This game is incredible. Picture a Magic: The Gathering draft, mixed with the roguelike elements of Binding Of Isaac or Darkest Dungeon. You pick a class and are given a standard deck. As you progress through randomly generated rooms, you come across creatures to kill and collect gold, treasure rooms filled with relics that help buff your cards or curses that hurt you, shops to buy new cards and relics, "?" rooms that can be filled with all sorts of treasure or traps, and eventually bosses. Each encounter gives you a number of cards to choose from and add to your deck. As you progress you basically draft your deck to help you beat the next encounters. It's an incredibly fun game with several different ways to play, plus the random element to it makes it just so entertaining. But alas, if you die, as in traditional roguelike fashion you are sent back to start, losing everything. It's a very fun game, definitely worth your attention and the $16 (on sale during early access). I'm normally pretty skeptical about early access, though as a streamer I like to try and have diversity and check games out when they're released. All in all, this is a game you should definitely pick up. It's pretty dang fun.

TLDR: Roguelike deckbuilder. Drafting in MTG mixed with Binding Of Isaac. SUPER fun. Lots of variants to play. Buy it!

39290244.review:
This game is great in almost all aspects. The enemies are challenging. The deckbuilding gives you tons of options. The graphics are simple, but great for what this game is.
The one downside for me was the length of the game. I beat the game in 6 hours. I didn't unlock most of the cards, but I feel like for players experienced with deckbuilders, the game is too easy. I can't recommend such a short game for this price. Hope the devs fix this during early access. That said, with a hard mode I see lots of replayability I would totally recomend this game.

Edit:Ok, so I've played some 14 more hours, at first trying to beat the game with the other class, but then trying to beat the game again with the same class, and my conclusion is that I got some insane RNGesus the first time I beat the game. I got some of the best combos of relics, which comboed really nicely with the cards I got, then got the bosses weak against these combos...
I definitely recommend this game now, so I changed the review. I can't stop playing it.

39289700.review: Awesome game that combines the best of card based games and rogue-likes. The game is a bit short, but very replayable, like any good rogue-like. Highly recommend.

39287592.review:
这两年玩过的最好玩的单机卡牌游戏

随机性超高。强卡超强。弱卡超弱。

非酋请绕道。

我曾无数次身揣巨款来到商店发现满店全是垃圾。

也曾无数次揣着五毛八毛的看着商店里的神化流出巧克力色的眼泪。

可以把这个游戏想象成升级版的炉石狗头人冒险模式

但是60个小时后感觉内容有点不够了。

自残卖血战。叠力量一刀斩战。叠甲肚皮战。枯树枝烧牌战。佛山无影脚战。然后我就想不出什么骚套路了。

小刀贼。陀螺贼。毒刃贼。毒瓶贼。杂技贼。甚至防贼都玩过了。原谅我的想象力贫乏。

各种蹂躏BOSS，肆意妄为，然后索然无味了。

无限期待第三个角色。感觉应该是个法师什么的。能量应该是蓝色方块或者紫色菱形之类的。

再不出新内容感觉活不下去啦。

39255273.review:
This game doesn't have 97% positive reviews for no reason, god dam is it good! 

I was watching someone stream this game and i was kinda confused, when i saw early access,  i was really hesitant but now that i played for a while i can assure you, if you like roguelike games in general, just buy the game! By far the best roguelike i've played since Binding of Isaac.

As far as i know the only thing that makes this game early access is that there is 1 character missing but the game feels like a full game, i have not encountered any bug at all and the two avalaible characters are really fun and unique. This is early access done right!

Also the games explains everything really clearly in game, it's super noob friendly even though there's pretty much no tutorial, this game is just so incredibly well designed.

Also, it's a good thing that the game is noob friendly because OH BOY THIS GAME IS CHALLENGING! This is the kind of game that you'll need a lot of runs just to make it to the final boss and good luck defeating it ;) The difficulty in this game is designed a lot like darkest dungeon, it's not about making it to the other side safe, it's about making it alive.

39249829.review:
好玩，没话说。
虽然人物还少，关数也不是太多（emmm？）
遗物或许玩上十小时就基本看全了（比如我）
卡牌搭配路线也不多（听听他们说的飞刀流、上毒流balabala）
但是我还是要说，这是一个单人游戏，是一个适合自己静下心来慢慢品味（或者说规划？计算？）的游戏。
人物少？以后会有的；关数少？（现在够你打的了吧hh）以后会有无尽关你信不信；
遗物卡牌少？这更不是问题啊，那么虚心的开发组肯定会加、会改平衡行性的。
至于如何搭配牌才更容易通关——其实哪来那么多什么套路，慢慢玩慢慢品味，就自然而然会发现哪些牌是适合放在一起的，哪些遗物看着好但并不该要，哪些事件该做哪些不该做。这还是一个很纯粹的策略游戏，你能在其中找到快乐的。

另外，我可以说这个游戏真的很看脸吗T.T（第一把就打到最后boss之前一点点，后来死活碰不上好的卡牌or遗物组合）

39248953.review:
방금 21시간만에 기적적으로 딸피 상황에서 30x6 데미지 휠윈드로 막보 깨고 와서 쓰는 평가글입니다.

 좋은 게임입니다. 장르는 로그라이크 카드 게임입니다. 당연히 RPG 요소가 들어가 있습니다. 매 스테이지를 클리어하면 나오는 무작위 카드와 렐릭으로 캐릭터를 강화하고 스테이지를 클리어 못 하고 죽으면 처음부터 다시 시작해야 하는 게임이죠.

 태생이 로그라이크이기 때문에 로그라이크적인 특성에 대해 언급을 안 할 수가 없네요. 단도직입적으로 이 게임은잊을만하면 출시되는 비슷한 류 게임들에게 좋은 귀감이 될만한 게임입니다. 로그라이크의 필수 요소인 확률요소가 아주 적당한 수준으로 조정돼 있습니다. 카드 뽑기와 렐릭 뽑기, 스테이지마다 나오는 몹과 이벤트가 바뀌는 정도가 아니면 전투 중에서 확률 요소는 카드의 드로우와 버리기 정도 밖에 없습니다. 하스스톤에서 많이 볼 수 있는 무작위 카드가 거의 없다는 거죠. 그래서 일단 덱을 짜고 전투에 돌입하면 정말 순수 실력으로 전투를 한다는 느낌이 듭니다. 언제 참고 언제 때려야 할지 명확한 느낌이 듭니다. 그래서 게임이 잘 안풀려서 캐릭터가 사망해도 "와 존나 운빨 좆망게임이네 X발" 같은 말 대신에 "아 아쉽다. 카드 뽑을 때 시너지가 너무 안 났다", ""방금 갈림길에서 캠프파이어로 가서 스미싱을 했어야 했는데..." 정도의 아쉬움만 남는 수준입니다. 그리고 또 다시 새 게임을 시작하는거죠.
 그렇다고 운빨 요소가 너무 적지는 않습니다. 이 게임을 하면서 로그라이크 게임이 재미있는 있는 이유가 토토나 기타 도박에 사람들이 중독되는 이유가 많이 비슷하다고 느꼈습니다. 게임이 너무 예측가능하고 매번 뻔한 양상으로 진행돼 버리면 재미가 없다는거죠. 게임을 하는 내내 예상할 수 없는 일이 일어나고 성공으로 이어질 때의 카타르시스가 바로 재미가 되는 것 같습니다. 이 게임은 바로 카드와 렐릭 간의 시너지를 통해 이런 재미를 느낄 수가 있습니다. 카드를 하나 두 장씩 모으면서 캐릭터의 컨셉을 잡습니다. 마치 하스스톤의 방밀전사 같은 빌드가 가능한거죠. 하지만 게임을 할 때마다 똑같은 덱이 나올 가능성은 0에 가깝기에 매 플레이마다 다른 경험을 하게 됩니다. 얼리 엑세스 중에서도 굉장히 개발이 덜 된 얼리엑세스임에도 깊이감이 있는 게임입니다.

 또한 카드의 능력 배분이 얼리엑세스 게임이라고는 믿을 수 없을만큼 잘 돼 있습니다. 초대형 개발사인 블리자드에서 만든 하스스톤보다 훨씬 더 다양한 능력들과 능력치들이 존재하는데 어디 하나 억지스러우 부분이 안 보입니다. 정말 사기카드인 것 같으면서도 특정 적의 디버프 앞에서는 너무나 무력해질 때도 있고 이걸 어디다가 쓰냐 하면서 패스한 카드가 나중에 플레이 하면서 시너지 카드들을 발견함으로써 사기카드가 되기도 합니다.

 별 10개 만점에 7.5개 정도 주고 싶습니다.정말 즐겁해 했기에 더 주고 싶긴한데 그래도 아직 컨텐츠가 너무 부족해요. 게임성에 깊이감이 있긴하지만 막보스를 깨고 나니까 목표를 상실한 느낌입니다. 스테이지를 더 늘리거나 다른 과제를 넣어주지 않는 이상 롱런하는 게임이 되긴 힘들 것 같아요. 반대로 지금 만들어진 부분에 대한 완성도는 정말 높으니까 단기간에 정말 정신없이 즐기고 싶은신 분들은 꼭 사세요. 12월부터 지금까지 산 10개정도의 블록버스터~얼리엑세스 게임들 중에서 개인적으로 이 게임이 최고였습니다 .

39247894.review:
然而游玩了50多个小时之后，我才第一次用毒卡组过关，要知道ea阶段本游戏一共只有三张大图，实际进行的战斗不多，一般一个半小时左右能打到最终boss。当然和我卡牌游戏玩的少，算伤害很粗糙，卡序经常出错有关，但更重要的是玩这类游戏需要理解relic和卡牌效果互相影响带来的化学反应。
卡组并非一成不变的，有很多时候个人以为是核心卡的一些金卡或能力卡并非真的100%必要，反而到了中后期学会取舍，前期积累下的牌组决定了最后成形的deck能否顺利通关。个人体感20~25张是比较好的boss战卡数，如果是烧卡流战士可以稍微多背几张技能卡来启动。而如果在剧情中拿到每回合结束选卡的relic，甚至必要的能力、技能、高级的防御和攻击个三张左右就够，至多也就20张足矣。
如上文所说，我并非卡牌游戏忠实玩家，但ROUGUE LIKE加单人卡牌构筑实在太有趣了。我一向喜欢万智牌、游戏王等卡牌类游戏，然而集换式卡牌需要的大量时间、金钱和社交能力都是制约因素，而STS这款游戏设计精良的卡组，风格迥异的两种（目前为止）职业，以及诡异地触摸到我G点的美术风格，再加上制作组淡淡的黑色幽默，都让这款游戏成为17年末独立游戏的一大惊喜。
最后要提醒各位新入坑开始爬塔的玩家，我个人虽然只是刚把两个职业都完全解锁，见到最终BOSS只有大概七次，但我怀疑制作组很坏，你要是小刀流多半最后碰见时间掌管者限制你每回合能甩的小刀数量并强迫你算牌。用毒或者叠甲的，多半遇见未觉醒的邪神，每上一次BUFF他会+3攻击力，叠完BUFF他刚好会开始猛攻。。。至于甜甜圈，个人觉得比其他两个简单（虽然我只过了邪神boss），注意先把加攻的那只干掉免得翻车。


昨天，我们攻克了高塔的第二层，今天我们来攻略spire的第三层地区。
首先我们选择这条路线……惊了！都没个商店的，丢人啊！
前面这个问号，很神秘
the chosen:只有风暴才能击倒邪神
silent：FNNDP！
通关之后MEOW都不请我吃香香鸡的，我要做二五仔啊！
我这个通关卡组，一共     张牌，你看不见不是他不存在。
是真实猛男，就来和我一起进入爬塔世界吧，你的时间非常宝贵，油腻的邪神就在这里！

39246629.review:
One of the best games I've played in a long time. This is not one of those:"It has potential" games in early access; it has an extremely solid foundation and the only thing it needs is more content, something on which the devs are already working on.
As it is now, a full run can take anywhere from 30 to 80 minutes and it's extremely challenging. A few things here and there can feel a bit unfair, but the balancing is fine.
Gameplay is extremely addictive and players are rewarded (or punished) for their choices. As with many roguelike games, knowledge of the game is a key to success. Being familiar with synergies, combos, powerful relics, knowing what monsters and bosses are capable of doing etc etc all drastically improve the chances fo success. I've only had a couple of runs where I felt scammed out of a victory  due to an end boss having an ability that countered my whole deck.

An amazing mix of roguelike and card games. It makes me glad to see the amount of positive reviews. I really hope the devs will invest a good amount of time into producing more content in terms of heros, cards and enemies. If this game had the variety/depth of Isaac it would be the kind of game I could play for years.

Since it's an early access, my wishlist is:

a) More content 
b) A survival mode with no end boss, where players can keep exploring levels of ever increasing difficulty
c) The game looks very mobile friendly to me, I'd love to be able to play it on my Windows tablet but so far the touchscreen hasn't worked for me

39234167.review:
https://youtu.be/3GG16Y0lI6w

Slay the Spire est un jeu qui mélange habilement le Deckbulding: c'est à dire un jeu qui vous demande de construire au fur et à mesure un deck de cartes pour combattre les evennement de plus en plus complexe que le jeu vous met dans les pattes. 

Pour ceux qui connaîtrais, c'est un jeu du style "dominion" ou "lord of the ring: the card game". Le deck n'est pas fait en amont mais pendant la partie.

Pour être efficace dans ce style de jeu, il faut savoir vers quoi on voudrait orienter son deck et ensuite adapter cette envie aux cartes distribuées par le jeu de manière aléatoire, certains idées de départ peuvent donc se trouver drastiquement modifiées.

On y ajoute une couche de Roguelike, c'est à dire des combats, de l'aléatoire et des morts définitives, de l'or pour acheter des cartes et des potions qui peuvent vous donner des bonus ou appliquer un malus à l'adversaire.

Le deck commence avec 10 cartes de bases: le personnage a 3 points d'action, chaque carte coute un certain nombre de point d'action, une fois ce total de point dépenser, c'est au tour de l'adversaire (IA) qui fait de même. si vous remportez le combat, vous gagnez or, potion et une carte à choisir parmi 3, gonflant ainsi votre deck au fur et mesure. Au bout du niveau, un boss, et ensuite un autre niveau, il y en a 3, très difficiles, chacun possédant 3 boss uniques (le jeu en choisi 1 par niveau). Si vous perdez tous vos points de vie, vous recommencez.

Le gros point fort du jeu: la simplicité de prise en main, malgré la difficulté du jeu, la clarté des concepts mis en place, il s'agit d'un bon jeu pour introduire à l'art délicat du deckbuilding.
Le jeu est difficile et on a toujours envie de relancer une partie pour essayer d'aller le plus loin possible.
2 classes très différentes dans la manière d'aborder le jeu (le guerrier = fort et bourin et le médecin de la peste = plus fourbe, se basant sur les malus à infliger aux adversaires).  Une 3ème classe est en création.

Quelques soucis:

-Manque de contenu, alors oui, c'est un EA mais si vous êtes doué dans le deckbulding/roguelite, vous en ferez peut etre vite le tour à l'heure actuelle.
• Le cara design est ...particulier, je ne suis pas sur d'apprécier, un coté pastel, un peu grossier, c'est voulu hein, mais je sais pas, moi ça me parle pas. La musique aussi, un peu grandiloquente, trop épique peut-être pour ce qui se passe à l'écran.

• très statique, il n'y a quasiment aucune animation.


Bonne pioche pour introduire le deckbulding en y melangeant du roguelike, pas beaucoup de contenu pour le moment, en esperant qu'ils étoffent le jeu avec plus de niveaux,..., cela dit, le jeu est très difficile et malgré tout, il vous occupera de nombreuses heures si c'est votre truc.

J'aime beaucoup mais je vais attendre un peu avant de m'y ploger à fond mais  le jeu maitrise bien son sujet, il manque juste un peu de chair autour de l'os.

39220172.review:
This game somehow hits all the buttons in my brain to make it so it's difficult to walk away from. Deckbuilding roguelike dungeoncrawler sounds like three random buzzwords but it really does work well. I'm really excited for the full release, and I hope that there's more cards and characters in the future!

one thing that does bug me is that as of writing this its very difficult to actually purposefully make a specific deck or work towards a given build. you start out with a basic deck, then you gain cards over time. half of the strategy is knowing which cards to pass on and which to take. the problem is that its very very difficult to build towards a deck you know and like, but rng has decided that you can't get that specific deck type this time. plus, in order to progress meaningfully in the game you should have a quasi-synergistic deck by the first boss, which doesnt happen all the time. 

factor in this difficulty with the other upgrade system in the game- the relics- which are wildly variable in how much they impact your run. some will make your run, others will disappoint you. theres a wide variance in the relic effects..

its difficult to progress through the game if you have a string of bad luck- skill can only get you so far in Slay the Spire. like most card games, it's knowledge of how to construct a deck that demands your skill and attention. 

Yet for these complaints, Slay the Spire is still a fantastic little game- when combinations work they work really well, when you feel like youve got a working deck it feels good to play. the art is great, the musics good, and as of writing it i've owned it two days and have played it for 16 hours. it's a good game- play it

39220115.review:
Incredible fusion of standard CCG mechanics with RPG and Roguelike elements creates a deeply compelling experience.  The major decisions you make are which cards to play, the path you take, and your choice of rewards.  The ability to modify your deck is limited to random drops after fights adding a card, random effects from events, and very expensive merchants from whom you can buy or remove cards.  Then the final twist is random `relics` that only drop from rare events and powerful monsters.  These provide minor rule changes that can vary from fairly innocuous to absurdly powerful provided you have an appropriate deck.

  The combat itself plays out in a turn based fashion, with your enemies always showing what they intend to do:  giving you the opportunity to counter whatever they plan as long as you draw the appropriate cards!
    
  These mechanics together create a delightful tension as to whether your priorities should be hunting relics, expanding your deck, discarding less useful or harmful cards, or even something else like scraping together enough health to survive the upcoming boss.  The variety and amusing synergy of some relics and cards provide a strong reason to keep playing. 

   Even in early access it`s remarkably deep tactically.  If you like card games or tactics heavy RPGs I completely recommend this title.

首先战士，很简单，最强的战士流派应该是进化伤口流，目测更新时候可能会削弱，玩了你就懂我的意思了，几乎无脑过一切小怪和boss。
刺客相比战士可以说随便过，选牌稍微有点思路就能通关。反正随便过，就推荐一个有趣的，需要冰淇淋遗物。然后就攒能量，苟住，我关底boss直接40能量一张牌带走。
没想到有一款跟月圆之夜这么像的游戏，也不知道谁先出的，总之都特别好玩。期待二者的更新。

I would describe it as a single player Dominion with FTL-style advancement. I'm sad I haven't found any "Lab" or "Market" type cards, I loved chaining those in Dominion. There are some cool cards though! My impression so far is that the game seems a little short, but as it's early access I'm willing to let that slide. I highly recommend it at full price.

39197167.review:
This game is fun. It has a solid concept, and a very good foundation to build on. The game's core mechanics revolve around ftl style node based movement, and combat that plays like a deckbuilder ( Not MtG or Hearthstone, think dominion or marvel Legendary Encounters). The few  complaints I have seen were about the rng and the difficulty, which honestly aren't that bad. I have beat the game once with either character, and that was within the first 5 or so hours. The game honestly isn't that hard, but it does punish sloppy play pretty heavily. 

I enjoy the game, but I'm not sure if I will sink hundreds of hours into it. The two characters are unique enough, and there are plans for a third character, which will help replayability immensely. I like this game a lot, I just think that it's missing that factor that pushes it into the upper echelon of roguelikes. Hopefully that comes when the game is released out of Early access. Even so I think it's worth the 16 bucks right now, and I think it will certainly be worth whatever it costs when it releases for real.

39196102.review: If you enjoyed the "Dungeon Run" mode in Hearthstone, you will LOVE this. Very well polished for an early access game and so much fun. I refused to go to sleep before i beat the game the first time.

39196011.review:
It's a fun rogue lite with basic deck building elements. But it's first and foremost a Rogue Lite. It's not a particularly deep card playing system, at least in the current early access, but it's fun and you kind of have to make due with what you can find or buy given it's a Rogue Lite. Relics also will alter the way you play and you can have as many relics as you can find or buy.

Two characters, for sure a third one is on the way. Each can be played different ways. Like FTL every run will be different in many ways, though you share the ultimate goal of beating the boss on all 3 levels. There are 2 or 3 bosses per each level.

It can be frustrating at times (I'm looking at you time wizard you cured over 120 poison and other statuses and still got to hit me for a 30 point attack) and you'll die and respawn and want to play again. 

Very fun game and hopefully it gets better. It just released in November. Support a great game made by some indie devs from Seattle.

卡牌和遗物的组合能打出流畅的combo，操作成就感很高，Rouge-like的关键随机要素处理的也不错，随机地图+随机掉落物+随机BOSS，玩熟了之后感觉有点像平面版的Binding of Isaac。

39192823.review:
Slay The Spire, even in it's current state, is well worth the money.
The game takes full advantage of the virtual format, allowing an absurd amount of variety in how you play. No mechanic is sacred, everything can be modified and abused. 
The constant risk/reward makes each decision massively impactful. For example, your route is for you to decide, with normal enemies, shops, elites, and other encounters, simply picking a starting point is tricky. This focus on risk reward is present in each mechanic of the game, making each run have it's own set of dynamic benefits and detriments.
I like it, at least.
