39467650.review:
TL;DR 50% deck-building + 50% turn-based strategy + 50% randomness = 150% awesome game. Just needs
more content.

You pick your character. A mysterious creatures greets you and hands you a scroll. A map. All the encounters and paths are presented. It's up to you to decide how you journey to the top. What awaits you at the top? The boss. Defeat him and venture forward.

You start with a relic and a handful of cards. These are your attacks, your defense, your tricks, your skullduggery, your whole armada of in-battle actions. As you climb the spire toward your ultimate goal, you'll encounter friends, enemies, merchants, treasure, and the occasional camp site to stop and gather your strength. Each floor you'll find something to help or hinder your journey. Each enemy, if defeated, will drop a card or relic and some gold to help expand your repertoire and thus improve your chances of beating the ultimate meanie.

By the end, if you manage to survive, you'll have a full deck of cards to play with as well as a large compliment of relics to boost your play. You pick cards after a winning battle from a group of three, and relics are random drops from elite enemies, so there is a large element of luck paired with a certain amount of strategy that makes every replay different -- for better or worse!

I've been on quite the binge with this game lately since every time I play, I discover something new...plus I still have cards and relics to unlock. Every deck I build ends up with a different theme just depending on the options presented to me and the choices that I make. I can't get enough of it. Therein lies the only negative of this game. Once you complete your three maps and defeat your three bosses, you're done! That's it. Start a new game. It's always fun, but I'm ready for some new content to keep things interesting. Thankfully, the development team seems to be constantly at work, and they make patches on a weekly basis. Keep them coming!

39467389.review:
Yesssss. Tons of fun. A classic deck building game. Important positive for a fairly lightweight single player game: you can quickly jump out and it saves your progress. Come back and pick up where you left off. Good for someone who needs to drop games on a moment's notice.

It's a deck builder like the tabletop games Dominion or Ascension. Takes a few play throughs to understand the mechanics, but it's not really hard to wrap your head around. 

The dungeon crawler element adds an extra layer of interest. You progress along a map, fighting battles via your deck, gathering gold to spend while visiting merchants, adding and upgrading cards (or removing them), and collecting treasure  - potions and artifacts - that modify gameplay. There are also random encounters for flavor but they seem to basically fall into the categories just mentioned. They're still fun.

As you progress along the map your encounters become more difficult and the rewards increase. Because you upgrade and gather treasure, each battle carries a little bit of weight. If you have a good run, it stings to lose, which is motivating and enjoyable. 

As with any deck builder there's some fickleness/chance to how you draw your cards. You're not guaranteed any particular synergy but when they pop up in your hands it's awesome. You can also draw cards that are not right for your situation, and get the opposite feeling.

The graphics are really bad but I get the feeling they're mainly placeholders. Even if they're not, the core mechanic is what makes the game fun. 

If you like deck builders, play this now.

39465922.review:
Pros:

+ Lots of different card combinations across both playable characters, ( Soon to be three characters ) which adds a ton of replayability.

+ Lots of items and statuses that can effect your character and your deck. Again, adding more replayability to the game.

+ Very easy to learn. You can get yourself out of most sticky situations with the help of some simple math. 

Mixed:

~ It's a card game, so there is RNG involved. It doesn't matter if you play your cards perfectly, you may find yourself losing often purely because of bad luck. It's something you should expect from a card game, but just know that not everything is stacked in your favor.

Cons:

- The visuals aren't very appealing. The developer(s) in the visual department may not have much experience with painting. Everything looks really sloppy and washed out IMO. That being said, it doesn't affect the game very much. It could be better, but the gameplay is what matters most.

--------------------

Overall, I think Slay the Spire is a really fun game, and I plan on playing it a lot more. This is coming from someone that dislikes most card games, so there's a chance that you might enjoy it if you hold the same opinion.

39454577.review:
首先感谢谜叔又一次为我们制作了汉化。
    13小时终于两个角色各通关了一次。作为一个几乎不玩卡牌游戏的人及一个喜欢rougelike类游戏的人，这款游戏很好的将两种元素融合在了一起，抓住了我的心。
    可以说是脸黑的人游戏体验极差，但是稍微用心留意、搭配一下卡组，就会有完全不一样的游戏体验。
    [spoiler] 沉默猎人比起战士要容易很多，疯狂叠毒再稳一手格挡可以说是基本上通关了。而战士所容易走的力量流则很难轻松获胜。其余的流派也很难保证获得核心卡牌，少一张可能就无法形成有效组合，甚至可能出现反效果	[/spoiler]但是通过战斗和事件不断获得强力卡牌、遗物，完善自己的卡组，从而战胜敌人。这种高随机性、重复可玩性正是《STS》真正吸引我的地方。并且一局游戏时长较短，也是游戏的优点之一，十分适合闲暇时间较少的人游玩。
    但是目前来说，游戏流程过短，卡组套路单一、固定，游戏角色少，是目前游戏的突出问题，但是相信开发者不会让玩家们失望的。
完全值得以52的价格购买此游戏。
8/10

39452799.review:
最近很紅的卡牌遊戲，稱它是一款「卡片構築模擬器」一點也不為過(ry
目前為EA階段，內容較少，暫時只有2個角色可供選擇，第3位角色會在遊戲正式上市之後推出
一輪遊戲只有3張圖，對於擅長卡牌遊戲的玩家可能3小時就能使用1位角色通關了

每個角色都有不同的玩法
這是基於每個角色初始卡組不同、遊戲歷程中獲得的卡片類型不同、以及初始Relic不同而造成的

遊戲系統主要由卡組、Potion(藥水)、Relic(遺物)所構成

卡片使用上為cycle制，因此使用過的卡片會在卡組被用完的當下重新回到卡組中
較粗略來分，卡片一般可分為攻擊型、防禦型、補助型以及cursed(詛咒卡片)這幾種
幾乎所有卡片都能upgraded(升級)至少一次，upgraded會提升卡片效果或是降低Energy cost
另外，使用卡片會消耗Energy(能量)
每回合都會回復Energy，根據使用的卡片或Relic的效果、以及角色基礎Energy量來決定下回合回復的量
其中較為特殊的卡片類型cursed，通常因敵人施法效果或是通關過程中的事件等情況產生
通常都無法被使用，亦或是造成玩家角色少量HP傷害等

至於Potion
最多只能帶3個，可於關卡中的事件、及某些Relic或卡片效果、商店購買來取得
Potion類型也不少，有造成敵人傷害、回復HP、防禦、debuff、buff等等

最後則是Relic
Relic不是像Potion那樣的消耗品，同時也沒有攜帶上限，並且是構築卡組中最重要的一環
可能因此構築出無限手牌、無限能量等各式玩法...

大方向都講得差不多了，其餘較深入的部分只能交給玩家自行摸索了(ry


這款遊戲目前看來相當有潛力，既使是通關時數過短的現在，也有一定的耐玩度
遊戲幾乎是每周固定更新一次，看得出開發團隊有心要把遊戲做好
就看之後是否會增加更多的地圖以加強挑戰性，亦或是增加更多的遊戲模式來滿足玩家了吧!!

39449129.review:
很好玩的一款游戏，不知不觉中就在三天内成为我游戏时间最长的单机游戏，现在最喜欢玩的是力量流战士和毒瘤刺客，但只有战士通关过一次，好几次死在第三层boss。
不过有些地方需要改进：
1.boss甚至是小怪经常打着打着突然冒出来20+的伤害，有时候甚至50+，根本很难堆出足够的防御，虚弱掉的作用也有限，一下半管血就没了——而且这种爆高的伤害有时候是连续出现的，直接能把你搞残
2.很容易被连续叠debuff，缺乏能够清除debuff的有效手段，以至于打个小怪被叠十几层虚弱、脆弱；同时敌人叠buff又太快了，后期分分钟十几点力量教做人
以上导致了，在这款卡牌游戏中，卡牌的作用事实上远不如遗物。我仅有的一次通关是第一层拿到铲子最后一整排遗物通关的
因此我建议增加一些消除debuff和对方buff的卡牌，提高奶卡的种类和数量(没记错的话现在刺客基本上就没有奶卡，战士也是少的可怜)，同时降低对方高伤的出现频率，最关键的，当有多个敌人时不应该有全部是攻击的情况(你知道我看到16+16*2+16*2的伤害时是有多绝望吗)

39448008.review:
我思考了很久，一直在纠结到底是要给好评还是给差评，然后最终还是给了个差评。
其实如果有中评的话，那么我或许就不需要如此纠结了。
要说这游戏推荐么？其实就个人的感官而言，还是推荐的。只是，并不建议游戏全价购买，可以考虑在打4、5折以上时再买，因为就目前的情况而言，真心不觉得这个游戏值这个价。
我玩游戏，很少会评价什么，主要是觉得没这个必要。但是这游戏，还是忍不住让我想说几句。
以目前的游戏情况而言，平衡机制其实是非常的糟糕，而且相对比较看脸，卡牌类游戏的策略几乎没有。
恩，我用了“几乎”这样的字眼，是因为，这游戏多多少少还是有那么一点思考的。
只是因为游戏设计者的机制问题，所以这类思考，主要是集中在要不要抽卡上。而并非是可以选择多种卡牌组成不同的战斗套路。
其实这游戏，说白了，或者说干脆点说，根本就只有一种套路：无论是战士流还是刺客流，其目前的核心就是少抽卡，然后以格挡反击、毒素反击为主要游戏手段。
我试了很多种玩法，很多种套路，但是最终能够保证稳定通关的，就只有格挡反击。
基本上，在遗物方面，只要拿到天鹅绒项圈、冰淇淋、干瘪之手，然后配合壁垒、恶魔力量，我就知道，这局基本不可能输了。
至于其他的游戏套路，真心的，非常的看脸。策略性和思考性，几乎被压缩到最低，游戏设计者仿佛是故意为了增加游戏难度而让敌人的实力有很强的增高，几乎没有所谓的平衡性与策略性可言。
但是就打发时间上，这游戏其实还不错。
也因此，相对而言，我是比较推荐这游戏的，只是并不推荐全款购入。或许，打个5折可以买来玩。
评价，暂时给差评吧，看以后游戏情况，再考虑是否……改评价。

39445259.review:
Gonna honestly have to go against the grain here - the game isn't terrible, and it does have a lot of nice CCG mechanics to it, but the more I play it, the more I notice a rather critical problem I feel cripples the deckbuilding element of the game.  The problem?  Block.  Simply put, the key to success in this game is simply to stack as much defense as you can - damage can come from wherever, and really the only damage card that you really want is 1 or 2 aoe attack cards, since you're running a gauntlet with limited healing and resouces.  While this isn't a problem for some, it kills variation in deckbuilding - I've put quite a few hours into it already, and beaten it 4 times.  All of my victories have basically come down to a grinding down bosses slowly while stacking as much damage mitigation as possible (this is also why the 1st character is much easier than the 2nd).  

Getting rid of or nerfing block isn't the way to go either - block stacking works because it's probably the most reliable deck to build around (i.e. less RNG from relics and such) - so changing block just means the game stops being strategic and more RNG based.

Course this is early access, so a lot can change, but those were just some thoughts after several hours of play.  I'll check back in a few updates to see if things have improved.

39445013.review:
首先 這遊戲有中文，但目前還是建議以英文遊玩。 [bata]chinese 在數字前面會有多顯示一個%g，而且不確定是不是設定問題沒有像english一樣顯示出該卡的傷害數值(2018/1/19)

玩了一陣子的感想是，遊戲本身十分有趣且變化無窮。
在每關會有一個大地圖，目標是選擇一條路線爬到最上面打boss。每回合抽卡，消耗資源(就叫他法力吧=3=)打出攻擊，技能等卡牌，清光敵人，拿完獎勵後繼續前進。光看這樣可能會覺得有些無趣，但重點就在這個"獎勵"。

獎勵大致上有金幣、藥水、遺物、卡牌 ，藥水能在戰鬥中使用;金幣則能在商店裡買其他三種物資，所以重點就在遺物跟卡牌上了
根據的你選擇能大幅度的改變你的遊玩策略(尤其是遺物)。比方說我拿到一張corruption(skill卡花費變0但使用後捨棄該卡直到戰鬥結束)，原本是想濾牌搭配crash(大量傷害，但只在手中沒有attack以外卡才能出)，在後來拿到一張dark embrace(使用後每捨棄一張卡就抽一張卡)，能在一回合打出爆發性的傷害;但卻在選了一個遺物:snecko eye(每回合多抽兩張卡，但卡片的消耗隨機)後，戰鬥變得十分看臉ww。又比方遺物runic domo能讓你多一法力但看不到對手下一回合的行動，無法預先格黨(格黨值在每回合開始時會歸0，不知道敵人啥時攻擊的話很容易浪費)就能搭配另一個遺物讓格黨值不重置但格黨卡數值-1.....
就這樣一邊前進一邊不斷修正自己的能力，而這還只是遊戲中無數的組合其中的兩個......

所以，如果喜歡地城探險、卡牌遊戲、隨機獎勵的遊戲的話，就來試試這款遊戲吧

39442807.review:
A refreshing experience both in the rogue-lite and card games genres. Slay the Spire's most recent comparison is to the Dungeon Run mode in Hearthstone, with the latter being free but providing an experience based much more on RNG and with much less hours of enjoyment. Slay the Spire is easier to pick-up and can provide much more rewarding gameplay by being less reliable on RNG and much more reliable on decision-making.

The game still lacks in content, wich is expected from an Early Access title, but still has enormous re-playability through almost infinite combinations of events wich leads to different decks each time you play. It could use more enemy variety, but all the enemies have their unique mechanics and require thinking ahead and memorizing their patterns.

Slay the Spire flows a lot better than any other card-based game in the market. Rare were the momments where I wanted the game to skip an animation. The timing between enemy turns and the ease to use your cards make for a dynamic and rewarding experience.

With all the different choices in deck-building, as well as pathing, random events, card order and resource management this game easily has one of the most tactically deep experiences in the genre.

As counter-points for this game is it's lack of action, as any card game, and the lack of stream/couch entertainment value. The lack of RNG and extreme predictability of enemy patterns makes this title much worse of a watch than it's counterpart, Hearthstone Dungeon Run. It is aimed at the single player experience, wich is a nice throw back from so many multiplayer/stream focused titles released lately.

Some of the art of the game seems very crudely made, specially the bonfire scenes. I suspect those are placeholders and, as the game comes out of early access, those will be upgraded.

Overall a very solid experience, priced correctly and worth of your time.

Currently they just moce forward and you take damage. (Some attacks are animated though). There are not alot of floors, i beat the game on my second try and I dont feel a need to continue. Hopefully the Devs will add more floors soon. The enemies are really cool at first, however you soon learn that there isnt that many. Some enemies are not very balanced as well. Last little thing, for the rouge you should call block "Dodge". I may sound like i dont like the game but i really do. I cant wait to see what the devs do next.

39440215.review:
Très bon jeu dans le genre Deck builder + Rogue like. 

L'aspect progression du Rogue like dans la mort se fait par nos connaissances des différents monstres/boss dans les patterns qu'ils utilisent. 
Le jeu malgré le fait qu'il soit en Alpha est très complet, ce qui laisse présager un très bon jeu à l'avenir. ( Plus de 10 heures de jeu sur un seul et unique personnage). 
De même, bien que certains monstres ( Le boss assassin notamment) mériteraient un équilibrages le jeu est en somme très bien équilibré ce qui le rend d'autant plus plaisant.

Bémol, la réussite ou pas d'un run dépend bien souvent des loots qu'on va avoir, à la même manière d'un isaac. Bien que dans isaac les simples stats de bases puissent suffir si on a suffisement de skill. 
Ainsi on dépend un peu de la chance bien que le brassage soit suffisement conséquent pour outrepasser cet notion. 

La difficulté est présente mais pas abusé. Elle est également réelle et non pas artificielle de par des mécaniques injustes (Sac à PV, dégat qui one shoot sans prévenir) ce qui en fait un excellent jeu au tour par tour. 

Egalement le style simple mais efficace et la simplicité du jeu font qu'il n'a pas beaucoup de bug. 

Un bel avenir est dédié à ce jeu bien qu'une verison française soit appréciable.

39437807.review:
I have over 500 games on Steam, but Slay the Spire is the first ever I bought in Early Access. And, oh boy, did it deliver!

This is one of the best roguelike games I played in my life. Even though there's not much content yet, the game offers a lot of deck building possibilities and strategies. Of course, it all depends on luck: I beat the game with Ironclad on my very first try, but it took another 5 tries to finish it with The Silent. These 6 runs took me 8 hours, but I still want more and look forward for the game to get more content.

So Slay the Spire is definitely worth buying even now since the game is already very polished and provides a solid experience and a lot of fun. Moreover, the updates are frequent, so I expect the game to hit release by summer 2018. Anyway, it can already be played for 10-20 hours before you meet all the enemies and unlock all the cards and relics. Not  bad for its price.

39437331.review:
终于打穿50层，用的是战士的力量流，叠加过牌苟住前期，等恶魔形态把力量叠高了用重刃和连续拳秒人。
叠加流看似无敌，但对牌序和构筑的要求更高。而且后期敌人血量高，伤害拔群，不是秒人就是被秒。一旦断牌就GG了。

给新人一些建议：
1、战士选卡前期武装+（一定要强化）很厉害。
2、多选过牌的牌，战士剑柄打击，耸肩都是好牌。祭品看见必选。
3、并不是每次选牌都必须选，质量差的、和卡组核心关联性低的都别选，拿了卡手还妨碍抽到核心牌。
4、防御很重要，这个游戏回血主要靠休息，缺乏回血手段（战士遗物回血其实很重要）。所以不要为了输出随便卖血，选卡的时候不要一味进攻，防御也很重要。
5、路线选择上多选问号和篝火，精英看能力打，半血以下打精英往往和送死没什么区别。到了篝火也别贪强化，回血机会难得啊。

39436308.review:
I don't normally write reviews for games because, most of the time, I can't be bothered. So I'm going to make this short and sweet.

If you're the kind of person who likes deck building, numbers and rogue-likes. Stop thinking, pull out your wallet and insert it as quickly as you can into your computer monitor until this game starts downloading.

The game, as of this review, contains 2 characters to play as. Each one offers a plethora of cards that offer anything from "Value deck building" (picking cards that are just purely powerful) to "Strategic/Thematic deck building" (picking cards that synergize with one another).

With that being said, there is still that unlying level of RNG beneath the RNG. 

You won't, out of the gate, be able to just build a deck with cards that are in the game. Instead, you acquire them through a multitude of methods such as 'events', merchant purchases and slaying enemies within the spire.

From here, you will need to try to find a common ground to build your deck around. This isn't even taking into consideration the amount of 'relics' that the game has that tend to change the rules of engagement quite frequently.

As far in as I am, it appears that unlocking and progression are similar to that of games like Risk of Rain and Binding of Isaac save for any more than 1 character to unlock. I mean this in the sense that you will pretty much be discovering items and unlocking cards for a good portion of the game. Afterwards, there's nothing much left to do except for running through the game repeatedly in order to see how well you do. 

This is likely due to it being in early access, though. So I don't want to sound overly critical.

With all this being said, the game, in its current state, is a solid starting point for development and I hope to see it grow into a much larger thing.

39432855.review:
요즘 핫한 다키스톤(다키스트 던전+하스스톤)을 사서 해본 후기.
20여 시간을 플레이 한 결과 운이 좋게 엔딩을 봤네요 아직 얼리엑세스 단께라 3단계 보스까지 나와 있습니다.
직업 클래스는 총 3종류지만 현재는 검사와 도적 둘을 플레이 할 수 있습니다. 

각각 특색있는 플레이를 할 수 있는데 간단하게 정리하자면 

전사-자신에게 버프를 걸어 강력한 딜로 적을 제압. //// 도적-적에게 디버프를 걸어 버티기 형식으로 제압. 
제가 엔딩을 본 클래스는 도적으로 중독을 걸고 방어를 쌓으면서 꾸준딜+버티기로 플레이를 했습니다. 
호쾌한 플레이를 하고싶다면 전사 // 지능적 플레이를 하고싶다면 도적을 하시면 될 것 같습니다.

플레이 하면서 좋았던 점은 새로운 방식의 플레이 요소(유물, 카드 제거, 물음표 방)와 상황에 따른 긴박한 브금, 눈을 즐겁게 하는 스킬 이펙트와 등장하는 몬스터의 다양성 입니다.(스테이지마다 고정적으로 나오는 보스 없이 다양한 보스가 준비되어 있어요!)

엔딩을 본 20여 시간동안 시간가는 줄 모르고 잘 놀았습니다. Slay the Spire 정식 발매까지 응원하며 돈아깝지 않은 갓겜 추천드립니다!

39431702.review:
I have had runs with AMAZING relic drops. I have had runs with HORRIBLE relic drops. I've played both of the classes that I've unlocked so far. I've played with all of the cards I have unlocked so far. I have still not beaten the second boss (The City). That doesn't bother me at all. Seriously. I do not want this game to be made easier. This game is not easy. You are going to die. A lot. And if you have played Dark Souls, Darkest Dungeon, or Hearthstone then this card game just might make you cry tears of joy.

Yes, I said card game. This may look like a dungeon crawler, but it is a card game. But not JUST a card game. It expertly combines the feelings of reward and satisfaction with the "well fuck" moments we all experience when you realize that you just fucked up. Queue watching yourself die. Again. The RNG elements are perfect and no run will ever be the same. Pick a path with few/no elites and avoid the ? tiles if you just have to know what you're getting into (lol), or play the way I prefer and YOLO gamble on as many ? tiles as I can hit. You get lots of loot, and you can buy even more loot on shop tiles, so you'll never feel like you're putting in effort for no reason. There is even a teaser of a storyline similar to that of Lost Castle (so far) that gives you interesting and diverse starts at the beginning of your run.

Pros:
+Loot, loot, and more loot
+Difficult gameplay that rewards thought and planning
+TONS of variety in cards, loot, playstyles, randomized map generation, and enemies
+Hints of an interesting story (I'm a sucker for lore, so devs please give more)
+Deserved deaths
+Interesting NPC's on ? tiles

Cons:
-The art style isn't for everyone. Personally, I love it. I would like maybe a little more interesting design, especially as the story develops. The three eyed slugwhale could be just a little bit more interesting.... please. But overall it is its own unique thing and people will like it or they won't.

-While there IS lots of variety in cards/monsters/items/etc, there is still plenty of room for more. The Steam page indicates two week patch periods with new content and such, so I imagine they are aware of this. Early Access, yo.

-Balance tweaks. Like I said, I don't want this game to be easier. However, there are some cards that just feel a bit underwhelming. This is particularly true when looking at their upgraded form. I've noticed this more on the warrior cards than on the rogue cards. +2 damage just isn't as interesting as things like "innate" or adding a status effect or something of the like. The costs of the warrior cards is also a bit high in places. I think some of those cards could benefit from having a -1 to cost as part of their upgrade. For example, the powers that deal with block. Most of them cost 2 and stay at 2 but, since warriors get fewer bonus action opportunities compared to rogue, it is usually a sub-optimal move to give up the majority of your turn to use that power card rather than either just blocking or hitting. I *ALMOST* got an awesome run set up using a shield bash strategy, but it fell apart because of those cost problems.

TL;DR

If you like card games and have enjoyed Lost Castle, Darkest Dungeon, Hearthstone, and/or Dark Souls then buy this game and enjoy. Lots of loot, die lots, tons of variety, active development, and hours of fun. Support the growth of games like this.

P.S. As I play more of this game and watch patches come through I'll try to keep this review up to date.

39430521.review:
说实话，开始看见52元的售价，作为一款还在测试阶段的游戏而言，售价略高。
BUT,STS的RGL类型的卡牌游戏的确让人眼前一亮，好久没有玩到这种有新意的游戏了
对于没有买游戏的正在犹豫的萌新了，简单谈几点，希望能帮到你们

1.制作组更新蛮频繁的，大约一周左右就能有一次更新，更新包括：增加游戏内容，削弱/增强卡片（遗物）等等。制作组还是挺注重玩家的体验和反馈，对于过强和过弱的卡都有着不错的更改，个人感觉不知道比某卡牌游戏高到哪里去了。

39510052.review:
Slay the spire is a card based rogue-like, with tons of replay value, and even in it's current state, it offers a lot of variation to each run, giving the player a varied playstyle each run. The main consequence, but onebi presonally enjoy, the true difficulty of the game is it's heavy RNG tide, some runs being near-doomed, but even with all the RNG, a players skill still counts twords making that RNG happen: will you risk fighting an elite for a higher power spike, or play it safe at a campfire, possibly losing on a game-breaking relic. Also some enemies are able to easily counter specific builds, and given so no run is truly "easy win", needing a little bit of skill to overcome such difficulties, but the learning curve isn't too steep, catching up quite easily
This is yet again an early acces review, and so, the game is rather solid in it's current state, but the buid options can get similar, in around 20 hours I could say I found around 3-4 core builds for each character, and hopefully, more characters (at least one so far "announced" in-game) will bring the game even more replaiability, and less similar runs.

39491005.review:
Alright, so I came down with the flu a few days ago and was looking for a new game to play while I was sick. About three days ago I bought this game, and I have to say it has been an enjoyable 18 hours.

It's early access, albeit you wouldn't really notice that. The only things that makes it obviously an early access game are:
-The third character isn't unlocked yet
-There are only three 'dungeons' in the game. The starting one, the city, and then this eldritch one.

I hope they plan to expand the spires with a few more dungeons... Three is rather underwhelming.

Oh, and lastly.
Fuck the Maw. Seriously.
A normal battle encounter with 300 health?
Excuse me?

Other than that single gripe (I hate that mob and I do not understand why it has such a massive health pool. Literally grind through it and get nothing worth fighting it, but unlike Elites it is unavoidable since it is a NORMAL encounter on the third/final part of the spire so bumping into it is complete RNG).

Now I do have to state something: I am not someone that enjoys deck building games.

But this game kept me interested, and I did have fun just making these crazy combo decks as best as I could. One time I even got a boss to 100+ poisoned and it was such a fun, satisfying feeling. So, I'd defo recommend it even in its current state.

39488011.review:
댓글보고 제 플레이 타임도 보니 어느새 21시간이네요 ㅋㅋ
재밌습니다+매우 제취향입니다. 

어차피 구매하실분은 TCG를 좀 아시는 분들이겠지만, 장르에 관심이 없으신 분은 재미가 좀 덜하실 수 있어요,
그런 분들에게는 RPG성이 좋은 메리트가 될 겁니다. 

제가 TCG를 좋아하는 이유는 덱빌딩입니다. 쩌...쩔어! 하는 덱을 짜도 대부분의 게임에는 카운터덱이 존재하고, 그게 재미죠.
이 게임은 덱 압축수단이 꽤나 제한되기 때문에 덱빌딩이 자유롭지 않습니다. 매직 리미티드룰로 게임을 하고 있는 느낌이 있어요.
그 빡셈이...재미이기도 하고, 특정 몬스터에게 효과적인 카드가 있는데 나는 그런 덱이 아니고? 몬스터로 그 몬스터가 뜬다면? 독 없이 0/1파워 카드 연타도적인데 적이 방어가 계속 쌓이는 적이라면?! 으아아아?! 그래도 최선을 다해야죠, 그러고 죽으면? 죽는거죠 하하하 딱히 제가 어제 이래서 하소연 하는 건 ...맞고요....아니 envenom한장이 왜 안뜹니까?! ㅠㅠ 

카드,렐릭의 무작위성과 반대쪽에는 루트선정, 드로우와 디스카드를 통한 전술성이 있습니다. 드로우에 랜덤성이 있긴해도 덱 전체가 일반 tcg보다 적은편이라 카드굴리는 건 꽤 작전대로 돌아갑니다. 
엘리트 잡아서 렐릭대박을 노릴지, 잡몹을 잡아서 카드를 회수하고 돈을 모을지, ?로 가서 아주 그냥 운빨에 리듬을 맡길지 거기도 유저분들의 선택입니다. 

재밌습니다. 기존에 있는 것들을 버무리긴 했는데, 결과물은 새로운 게임이에요. 

로그라이큰데 플레이 하면서 바뀌는 건? 상대적으로 좋은 카드와 렐릭이 풀립니다. 아 하지만 그게 플레이에 나온다는 보장은 없지요...저 스컬 한번 먹어봤어요...표본 먹어보고 싶어요...


플레이 팁이라면 3단게 엘리트는 무지막지하게 강하기 때문에, 덱파워에 자신이 없다면 피하시는 루트를 선택하시는게 좋고 ㅠ 
반대로 1스테이지는 피관리 조심하면서 싸우면 엘리트 만나도 거의 만피일테고, 그럼 실수하시지 않으면 거의 엘리트 잡으실 수 있으니 적극적으로 도전하는게 나은 거 같습니다. 
카드는 물론이고 렐릭도 안받고 스킵할 수 있습니다...게임하시다보면 알겠지만 은근 함정유물이 있어요, 물론 덱에 따라 시너지가 날 수 있기도 하고, 특정 보스가 안뜨면 문제없는 렐릭일수도 있고 하기는 한데...

한편 한글패치에 야악간 오류가 있어서 영어상관 없으시면 영어가 낫고 아니면 플레이해보고 뭐가 오류인지 몸으로 제대로 놀아보!시면 됩니다. 

저는 첫 클리어를 실드차지 없는 방어전사(ㅠㅠㅠ플레이중 실드차지 한장도 안나옴요)로 깼고, 두번째는 팽이들고 데몬폼+낮은 코스트 공격연타전사로 깼습니다. 아직 도적으로는 못깨봐서...카드가 있으면 유물이 없고 유물이 있으면 카드가 없고 ㅠ 깨러가야지요...

그리고 강추 카드는 전체카드 업그레이드하는 신성, 그게 안되면 업그레이드 장착(한글명이 정확히 뭔지 모르겠는데 방5+카드한장업그레이드 그 카드요), 그외 각종 드로우 카드입니다. 상점은 뭐가나올지 모르니 250~300원대 정도 여유있게 들고 들어가시는게 좋습니다. 잭스, 황금우상처럼 연계이벤트도 있습니다. 저주받은책 이벤트는 체력에 여유가 있다면 적극추천하는 이벤트입니다. 네크로노미콘+리퍼+병속의불꽃=profit!
고래선택지중 3체의 적 hp1은 사실상 페널티 없는 렐릭1개랑 같습니다. 

또....뭐 도움이 될만한 게 있지?!음...전 도적카드중에 적 힘 깍는 외침카드도 좋았습니다. 

여튼 tcg좋아하는 사람이나 안좋아하는 사람이나 추천할만하며, 재밌게 즐기고 있는 게임입니다.

39487958.review: Slay the Spire затягивает не на шутку! Отличная игра совмещающая в себе 2 жанра, коллекционная карточная игра + roguelike. Частые обновления и пополнения карт, интересная система боя делают ее стоящим творением.

39487915.review:
Quick pro/con. Details below.

+Constant Dev Balance/Updates
+Animations pleasing to the eye
+Soundtrack fits and is great to listen to
+Lots of replay value
+Characters (2 at time of review) are very unique

-It's actually too hard
-Getting certain synergies is extremely hard
-Too much randomness

Great game. Lots of love went into this title and it really is obvious from the smooth and very pleasing animations to the soundtrack that lets you immerse yourself. Truly very little to complain about. There are only a few things and I think it's mostly something they can and are fixing as time goes on.

Difficulty being one of those things... It's actually quite a hard game. It's hard in that as you go along if you don't have a synergy by like mid floor 2 you're going to lose. You just can't get traction that late in the game and you WILL lose. There aren't enough random events that help you overcome that unlucky event/card draw. There also aren't enough ways to heal youself that are consistent. Since each floor and path is random and the cards you get are for the most part totally random you're at the mercy of the RNG mechanic to determine if you win or lose on any floor at least 75% of the time. The classes aren't really the issue here either as each one is pretty balanced and very fun to play and quite strong in their own right. It just all comes down to RNG. 

These are the things that dictate a successful run right now: Did you get an amazing draw/relic after talking to the whale in the beginning? Did your first couple enemy rooms grace you with easy wins and great card picks aftter? Did you get a synergy strong enough to start farming relics from elites? Were the elites you rolled ones you're capable of killing with current loadout? Did the shops have great items? Did you get good card draws on the boss fight or any fight for that matter? Notice that not once did I mention anything about player choice. Oh trust me you CAN screw up. You WILL make mistakes. You'll misplay a round or two or not min-max the cards you get and lose or set yourself up to lose. But that's only the remaining 25% of the reason you'll fail. If the devs can come up with ways that can allow you to skillfully or at least somewhat consistently fix a broken or bad run midway through it'd go a long way to making a more fun experience. Still recommending.

39484202.review:
Oh my. So, let me start this off with: I hate card games. I hate getting screwed over by RNG. But, what I saw of it on youtube made me consider it potentially fun. So, I got it from a friend.

I was blown away by just how engaging this game was lol. Likely because It's a deck buiding game, not a TCG. You just have so much control over so much in the game, despite its central mechanic being playing random cards. You can see the entire floor plan of the spire, up until the next boss. So, you can plan out an efficient route that gets what you want. You can choose to not add cards to your deck, which means you draw your cards more times in a single fight. (Discarded/played cards are returned to the deck once it's empty.) And so much more.

So, yeah. I went ahead and bought this game, if only to try and support the developer.

Side note: It actually moved my save file from my friend's version over to this one. How nice. Even getting the achievements and unlocks and everything.

Unfortunately, due to being very early in development, there is quite the limited amount of actual content, and you'll quickly start repeating content and content.

39484126.review:
(Early access review)  

Get ready to spend upwards of two hours on an ultimately disappointing experience. I don't recommend it.  For one, the game is incredibly unbalanced in favor of a few annoying enemies and bosses.  Until you reach these hiccups, the gameplay is actually pretty good.  Don't be fooled.

Early game is droll.  2 character choices in early access with no real room play creatively or customize a deck or a play style hurts the replayability.  The card pool is actually kind of small, and the most interesting cards/ relics are locked behind awkwardly high score thresholds.  Block, block, strike.  Repeat x amount of times.  Get used to this...

The mid game deck building is fun.  Theory-crafting how your cards and relics will synergize is interesting.  The music is rhythmic, the art is gorgeous, the sound design is charming.  It feels like you're in for a good time.  But these feelings quickly wane.  Once you reach the end of Act 2, welcome to the thunderdome. 

Despite meticulous and technical decisions based on the gameplay and character deck, your efforts are thrown in trash as your tougher foes simply hit you for over half your total HP per turn.  No "exhaust this" or "this action triggers that buff."  It's simply "did you draw a game breaking hand?  No??  Then you lose."  It isn't creative difficulty.  It isn't some sort of skill check.  It's simply a matter of building a deck that fits the meta and hoping you hit the necessary 1-in-50 odds.

Granted, these enemies are only found in a handful of places.  Namely, Act 2 boss "The Champ," Act 3 elite enemy "Nemesis," and Act 3 boss, "Time Eater."  There are some other encounters that are pretty bull shit, but these three really stand out.  If you don't draw the short stick with these enemies, congrats.  You win.  Otherwise, you might as well alt+f4 as soon as you see them and save yourself the frustration.  It only goes one of two ways.  Either find a way to abuse each characters deck mechanics the same way over and over, or waste 2 hours by geting hit for 60 damage per turn.  Either way, pretty disappointing.

-How to Win-

Ironclad - Barricade + Demon Form + Heavy Blade.  Everything else is a block.

Silent - Nightmare + Catalyst + Noxious Fumes.  Everything else is a block.

Oui, en clair bon jeu.
Le système est vraiment sympa, je ne vais pas refaire le topo sur le mixe entre Dungeon crawler et jeu de carte, suffisament d'évaluation en fond mention.
Contrairement à beaucoup de review, les graphismes ne me gêne absolument pas; c'est soft et efficace.

Ce qui me dérange plus par contre est le fait que vos cartes en main soient toutes retirées à chaque tour, donc inutile de prévoir une stratégie sur plusieurs round vu que vous aurez de nouvelles cartes (aléatoire bien sûr) à chacun des début de votre tour de jeu.  

Le second point négatif est qu'après chaque run, beh vous avez rien de plus qu'au run d'avant, pas d'upgrade, rien, et ça c'est quand même l'essence d'un dungeon crawler me semble t-il: débloquer un tout petit bonus, qui facilite le run d'après et qui pousse toujours et encore à lancer une partie.

39476526.review:
TWO REVIEWS ONE TROLLY AND ONE SERIOUS FURTHER DOWN WHICH I MARKED!

I do not know how I ended up buying this game. All I know  is that I was fedup with all my  other games and went onto steam and purchased the first reasonably priced game i found.

Now you have to understand, I did not know what this game was,  I did not know the genre nor did I even look at its reviews. This was a total  blind purchase. I expected to refund this gameaftertrying it but something happend. Iimmediately  recognized the rogue-like genre, and unlike FTL i was able to survive two random events, and the card style of battle,  which is honestly  pretty easy to grasp but has incredible depth to. Its already a better card game than hearthstone. But something even more amazing happend.

I am playing this game enjoying myself not really strategizing much but I can give a rundown of what my first Act 1 end boss fight looked like. 

At the end of your turn the  following effects happen:
>Gain 5 Strength (each strength increased damage by 1 of your cards)
>Lose 1 Hp and deal  5 Damage
>Gain 6 Block (block is the mechanic in which shields for the specified amount of damage but goes away after your opponent attacks even if they do not break all of it.)

Maybe that does not sound that insane but after a couple of turns even my weakest cards were dealing at least 20+ damage while the boss cannot touch my health thanks to keeping my block after each turn.

After losing in this run I  began another in which I accidently skipped accepting a relic, lost 16 hp to  claim a relic only to fight a boss that hit me for 35 damage on the second turn.

10/10 would risk getting cursed for a possibly good relic again.



[ Serious review below ]



This is a rogue-like  where even though RNG can ravage your bodily orphices it has enough  strategy and depth that I have yet to play two similar runs. The RNG is not like Darkest Dungeon where every move can be your last. Once you learn the enemies  you know what  to expect from the battle although the battles themselves are random so there is  still that. The combat of the game is pretty simple and straight foward but in order to progress through the game you will need to play to the relics and cards you earn because  later enemies just  hit so hard and have so much hp. There is plenty  of depth to the game especially with curse cards and the ability to thin  out your deck  by removing  cards. While im sure most people will  remove curse cards which are bad for you there  is also the possiblity of removing cards so that you can draw specific cards more often for crazy combos,  thisis supported by the fact that after a battle where you normally adda a card to your deck you can ignore that andjust not  add a  card. The classes are also unique and I cannot wait for more to be released. Can easily see this being a 100+hour game for only $16 in beta so in my opinion

10/10 Would buy again.

39474057.review:
这游戏，初看，是被roguelike+卡牌的组合所吸引。众所周知，roguelike算是被玩烂了，同类几乎烂大街的程度，但由于本人的受虐倾向（咳咳），还是乐此不疲，这次还打着卡牌这个另一种让我着迷的分类，毫不犹豫，我就跳进去了。

先说游戏性吧，玩过万智牌啦，炉石啦的，应该很容易上手，大体就是每回合抽5张手牌，每回合3点法术力（游戏里说法是能量），未使用的牌在回合结束时置入弃牌堆，然后抽牌堆空了以后，弃牌堆全部洗入抽牌堆接着抽。卡牌种类分为攻击，技能，和能力三种。总的说来不是很复杂，上手度适中。然后平衡性一般，毕竟roguelike这种看脸的游戏，平衡性要做到很让人舒适是很难的。再一个就是敌人，大体分为三种行动模式，攻击，debuff，和buff，然后随着游戏进程的推进，血量，攻击，和怪本身的特性，会有所提高和增强。就目前较为简短的游戏流程来看，卡牌的配合和怪的针对性还是蛮有看点的，虽然还是少不了很多就个人来看很不出彩的“废牌”，当然，可能不同的组合能让绝大多数人有各自的想法和流派，这也是乐趣之一了。除了流程较短（总共3层boss），卡牌种类不够丰富，以及相应职业较少（值得一提，每个职业的牌组是独立的，目前有两个职业，也就是说两套完全独立的卡牌）以外，看在游戏开发进度的份上，我给8/10。
音效，嘛，可圈可点。场景音效以及气氛烘托做得还行，配合攻击动画啦，打击感还成。我只喜欢回复音效，不要问我为什么（滑稽）。我只是来钻研游戏的，关了声音一样玩（不要打我）。就暂不评分了，有失偏颇。
值得一提的是，游戏画面风格，比较符合个人审美，卡通混合真实又稍显夸张，抛开很多怪很丑以外（划掉），整体视觉效果很酷，很赞。混入个人因素，评分7/10。

接下来就是卡牌分析了，嗯，比较繁琐，懒得看的可以撤了。

首先，第一点，这个游戏是苟的游戏，你能苟下去，你才能赢，你要硬gang，你就可以免费回程了（滑稽）。为什么这么说呢，因为这个游戏，回复很少，只有营地能回30%的血，以及战士每次战斗结束回6点，以外，就只有奇迹才能让你回血了。（商店卖一张回复卡，好像是4点血，消耗牌，也就是说不出意外一次战斗只能用一次；随机事件有上贡品事件，几率回复满血；随机事件有狼人事件，可替换基础攻击卡为撕咬，6攻→7攻+2回复（好像只有战士能触发？；遗物有boss战前回25；遗物有战斗后回血；遗物有营地回血。。。）综上，脸帝就是无敌的（滑稽）。好了，回到正题，回复少，怎么办。那就只有究极办法，绕开战斗（滑稽）。在路线选择上，尽量避免遇怪，这不是逃跑，读书人的跑，怎么能叫逃跑呢。当然，需要刷分的另说（个人不是刷分党，刷分请挑精英战斗，战况惨烈，收益还不如通关，请自行斟酌）。？可能触发敌人，这个没办法，毕竟看脸，除此以外，尽量走宝箱啦，营地啦，商人啦，反正不要战斗，苟下去，才能赢。然后避不开呢？首先一点，格挡（相关机制比较繁琐，还有很多套路，暂不详细介绍），总之，能少受一点伤是一点。这里需要注意的是，有的精英怪和boss甚至小怪需要速刷，时间越久，伤害越高，根本扛不住，请在熟悉敌人的前提下适当格挡，当然如果是纯新人，还是尽量格挡吧，毕竟能多苟一会。尤其是用游侠的同志，你是个脆皮，千万记住你是脆皮，你基本没有回复能力，猥琐格挡是你唯一的出路，别想着硬gang，接下来的路长着呢。
再一个，是爆发，记住同志们，死人是不会打你的，能杀就杀，一套带走就不用猥琐格挡保命了。爆发比较足的呢，大概是战士吧，很多实用高伤的卡，比如完美打击，开局就开始囤带“打击”的卡吧，再收几个完美打击，那伤害，实在。然后战士卡有易伤debuff的，神卡，增加50%攻击伤害，后期爆发绝不可少（拿到增加到75%的遗物你就偷着乐吧）。当然战士还有走消耗流的，个人不太推荐，消耗卡只有一次使用，后期战斗拖太长容易翻车。然后游侠嘛，毒，必须毒，毒才是王道啊，“催化剂”，神卡，再来个复制，刷几点法力，无敌，秒伤上千不是梦（然而看脸的世界，哪有那么多← 完美 →）。
最后，是boss，和部分精英怪，就此带过，不细谈了，死多了总会懂的（跑）

嘛，总的遗憾，就是流程稍短（才3个boss，根本不能满足我的抖m之魂），希望将来开发程度更加完善，还有新职业，也是非常期待的。

39473696.review: 3.5小时第一次打通。。。看现在的样子大概是要打通好几次才能迎来最终楼层。虽然是卡牌游戏，但是却有点像以撒和dead cell。虽然通过周目积累可以解锁新的卡片和遗物，但是只是解锁其存在的可能性，而不是直接给你。不能像dead cell一样积累优势，所以这点上更与以撒接近。总体来说还是不错的游戏，三关的强度刚刚好，再多一关我也不觉得我能打过去了。不过真的没想到二周目就能第一次通关hhh，打击套装真的强，一手打击牌再加上两张升级所有卡牌的牌嘿嘿嘿。。嗯，主要是有中文，好评！

最开始的时候是一个朋友给我推荐了手机上的月圆之夜。就感觉卡牌游戏真有意思。然后就想找类似的，本来打算买命运之手，不过还有动作这方面的倾向，不是我想要的妖艳贱货。然后找啊找，终于找到这款游戏了！！！
优点：
          1.牌的数量不会太多，也不会太少，不会让人觉得很难上手。
          2.怪物的难度也比较适中，不会说瞎几把就能过关。
          3.有两个职业，是不完全不一样的玩法。据说还有第三个在制作。
缺点：
          1.短小啊，真的太短小了。。一次游戏下来就三关。好不容易攒了一套可厉害的卡牌，还想着挑战更高难度都不存在的。短，真的短。。
          2.第二个职业妈妈没有玩，不过卡和卡之间差距真的挺大的。。。有的卡真的 没啥用的感觉。几局游戏下来玩第一个职业基本上就是用恶魔化加燃烧加力量加倍，然后叠到几十点力量，然后BOSS随便秒。。。可能自己组的不是很好，不过这样玩基本都通关。。。稳稳的，如果能加强一下就好了。
建议：
           1.我要无限的高塔！！！
           2.我也想可以召唤爪牙，感觉好有趣，或者能收小宠物啥的？？

39530216.review:
This game's okay. I guess it depends where you're coming from wrt experience with other deck-building games.

The game encourages building a synergistic deck over a generic "good stuff" build, but you often won't know if you get your payoff relics/cards until very late into your run. There are _some_ things you can do like planning your path to encounter more chests/question marks/mini-bosses/stores to give yourself more opportunities to get the payoffs, but at the end of the day you could just get hosed by RNG. And that feeling kinda sucks knowing that you didn't lose because of a misplay, you lost just 'cause of variance in the game.

It's like getting mana-screwed and losing after mulling down to 4 except it literally never happens to the other guy, ever, because the other guy is a computer.

It's probably better than most early access titles and will probably get better as more cards/events are added/balanced. I think I got my money's worth out of this game.

39505729.review:
This game is essentially about completing a dungeon, but it adds to this simple idea in a number of ways. Each "attempt" starts you off with a basic deck of cards and you have to navigate your way through the dungeon by passing nodes. These nodes include monster battles, a visit to the merchant's shop or even a random event.

Most of the gameplay is in turn based battles pitting your hero and deck against an enemy.
As you navigate your way through the dungeon you are rewarded with being able to build and improve your deck by a number of methods.

+ Fun and addicting gameplay.
+ No microtransactions.
+ Great music.
+ Nice artwork/graphics.
+ Leaderboards and extra incentives to keep playing after completing it once.
+ Unlockables.
+ Some humor and easter eggs thrown in.

- Can be a bit easy once you know the best strategies.
- At the moment it lacks content and polish. The basic skeleton of a good game is there though and I am looking forward to seeing how it develops.

A true rogue like, yet not the type of game that pulls you in a deep maze of depression which is probably due to the high replayability and the matter of fact that every run/build is going to be different.

Took me ~ 12 hours to beat the final boss. Most of that playtime was accumulated in one run because I just could not stop pushing it further - this game is highly addictive!!

I hope the devs keep their promises regarding the content updates so that there will still be a reason to replay the floors. Nonetheless the current content you are being given is incredible for an early access game and a rogue like of it's kind in general. 

If you have not yet tried this game and want to dive into a true and at some point very satisfying rogue like, then I highly recommend buying this game - the price is absolutely justified

39611418.review:
This is really fun!

Closest thing I can liken it to is the new Dungeon Run feature in Hearthstone. This game doesn't quite come close to the rogue-like depth of Binding of Isaac, but it does break through to being in the same category as that game. There's enough variety in the game to really give your deck and gameplay a different style every time you play. 

For example, I've completed the game once with a deck that struggles at the start but gives you more powerful attacks the longer the fight goes on, until you hit like not just a truck, but 50 trucks and you have to find a way to survive the fight until then. 
The second time I've beaten the game, however, was with a deck that let me keep my Shield points between turns (normally they expire) and occasionally I could cycle through to a card that let me deal my Shield points' worth of damage to enemies, so each turn I had to focus on ending with a net gain of Shield points and turtling hard.

A very unique mechanic in terms of card games is that you can occasionally remove cards from your deck. This not only serves to get rid of debuff cards you might get through unfortunate events you encounter that negatively pad and destabilize your deck, but it also helps you remove any other card in order to keep your deck more consistent and help your strategy.
There's also relics which add a variety of modifiers to your gameplay.

The game has two characters, with a third one coming soon, but in all honesty I don't like the 2nd character's cards.
Despite that, still a great game!

39602021.review:
I'm not sure how I found this game anymore, but boy am I glad I did.
At first when looking at the game, it didn't look very impressive and definitely not worth $16
But, since I'm such a sucker for deckbuilding games I couldn't let this one simply pass by, so I got it.

Then I started playing it, and before I knew, several hours had gone by and I still hadn't slayed the spire with the first character, yet it as an incredibly enjoyable experience. Ever since then, I've been doing at least a run per day and still encountering new stuff, or learning about new possible combos and possibilities.

Slay the Spire is a roguelike deck-building game where you climb a tower, going from encounter to encounter, defeating your enemies, obtaining epic loot and improving your deck by adding new cards, removing older cards and upgrading cards.

It's also roguelike, since if you die, you gotta restart your run and start from scratch. 
Every time, you get just a little bit further and it's possible to level up your character, which persists through runs, unlocking new cards and relics to obtain in future runs.

All in all, Slay the Spire is a fun, challenging deck-building game with immense replay value, and that's just in early access. Can't wait for future content.

Is it fun? Meh, kind of...for a little while.

I like deck building games, I really do. But this game felt like it only had 1 or 2 possible strategies to win. It really doesn't have many cards to choose from, and the runs through the 'dungeon' were incredibly short.

My main source of diasspointment is:
I beat the game in less than one full evning's play.

It just wasn't hard to figure out. Experimenting after the fact wasn't really fun either. The cards are just too darn obvious as to what is a "good card" and what is a "bad card". Rather than thinking about 3 or 4 card combos that syngerize like most deck builders, its really a matter of "Meh 0 cost cards are good and I need some draw", or "hitting 3 enemies for 32 is better than hitting 1 for 8...", or upping my strength or dexterity just wins me the game period. (especailly with a card that counts str 5 times!) 

I felt like my IQ was just too underestimated. If they have to cater to the lowest denominator they have to at least make addtional challenge optional for those that need it.

If I buy a game listed in the "strategy" genre, I really want to be challenged for more than one evening.

I know it's EA. When and if it changes, I will change my review. EA games seldom do, but we'll see.

39597198.review:
After a considerable amount of hours playing as ironclad I decided to put my mind into words.
Rant alert. You were warned.

The game is fun to play at the beginning. With few unlocked cards / relics to begin with, you can set a tactical approach into motion. Thin out the deck, put that card in, upgrade the other, it feels as if the deck tactics are deployed as you play.

However, as new relics / cards are unlocked as you play, the game increasingly starts to turn into a poker drulling spam fest.

It seems that cards offered are completely random. In most cases you are offered cards that contradict previous picks. Relics too. As for 3 cost cards, they are basically unplayable since on later acts you need to play 6+ cards a turn to defeat a common enemy. At least some of them are "rare" so you won't bump into them that often. As for the playable options for ironclad (for me), it seems it's either a Clash-spamming mechanic with a few drawing options or a block-build provided you find Impervious / Barricade / Metalicize early.

At the later stages of the game it's finally becoming frustrating. There are so many unplayable cards to begin with.
And once you've unlocked every ironclad card there is, forget about tactics. If you are constructing your deck towards a tank build, might as well block shots with your face. You will soon come to the point of a "Act 1" do-over". 

Cut-scene and a retarded whale tells you "at least reach the first boss before it offers a reward / drawback which is not skippable. The rewards themselves are laughable. I mean, I would laugh if I weren't in a catatonic state already.

The ending itself seemed idiotic as well but I won't go into spoilers.

Pros : The game is in early development.
          Amusing PVE content in the early stages of the game.
          Reasonably tactical game with cards instead of actions (in the early stages of the game).
          Music score.

Cons : Too much randomness on the mid to end stages of the game.
           Card rarity means the rarer it is the worse it is.
           Lots of card rebalancing needed.
           Ending.

39596280.review:
TLDR: Buy this game!

Up until I played this, I hated deck building games. Now Slay the Spire is quickly becoming one of my favorite games. It feels like every card has it's use and most cards could feel right at home in any deck while others have more niche uses. Nothing beats the feeling of getting an amazing synergy and decimating every enemy you face. The relic system adds a fun risk reward system. You get relics either by killing elite enemies, opening chests, or from random events. So you have to be willing to risk fighting the tougher enemies (as that is the most reliable way to get a relic) if you wanna build up your relic colletion and you definitly will. Relics can make or break your run. Some give more energy to play more cards and others augment how you play them. The only real complaint I really have is that enemy variety is a little lacking, but this also works to your benefit as the smaller enemy pool allows you to learn what each enemy does and thus learn how to counter them. All in all, Slay the Spire is, in my opinion, one of the best games on steam right now and it's still in early access and don't let that turn you away. The devs at Mega Crit have been doing weekly balance patches and content updates, as you would expect for an early access game. The content currently in the game totally justifies the price and I can only imagine it getting better in the future. Definitly consider buying this game

39594073.review:
[b]The Review[/b]
I can't recommend this game enough right now! I was a bit skeptical at first as it felt too easy in the beginning. On the day I bought the game I played 2 runs, first one I loss, second one I won! I thought, wow, a roguelike shouldn't be this easy to beat, kind of boring that it only has 3 bosses aswell. I ended up playing exactly 118 minutes, which is still eligible for a refund. I called it a day and went to sleep, woke up, went to work, came back, and out of pure instinct I reopened the game and started doing a run, something just grabbed me in the game, the RNG is decisive yet controllable. You can choose your path, the way you build your deck, the decisions you make, what you buy and what risks you might take in combat! Everything is something that must be thought of.

[b]Art & Music[/b]
There isn't much to say besides I love the simplicity, its easy to understand, yet beautifuly drawn besides some of the card art which I might appreciate less. I'm excited to see what else will be added artwise!
The music ins't anything new either, but it feels fitting for the game it is, giving you a feeling of pressure in each match.

[b]Base Mechanics[/b]
The combat is as basic as it can be but also diverse, mobs feel different from eachother, each having their own (some unique) abilities and patterns. 
The random encounters, while there are only a few of them (I believe I have encountered all of them) feel special because its never predictable, you could be going in for big loot or certain penalty, and its up to you to decide if you want to take the risk!
Bosses altough not many, feel unique in their own way and carry a lot of flavor with their abilities.
Deckbuilding is easy to manage, you always have access to your deck and you can add cards by winning combats (not only, but mostly) and remove cards in the shop (not only either, but mostly, and for a cost)

Now with 25 hours in I've already won over 7 times, and let me tell you, its all about making the right decisions and choosing the right RNG. 

Now what do I mean by that? Let me give you some tips first! (If you want to avoid gameplay spoilers avoid this section and go straight to the TLDR!)

[b]Tips[/b]
Early on you should focus on getting cards into your deck, aka do a lot of small mobs, if you are going with the Ironclad don't be afraid to take risks, you heal after combat and with a good health management you can get to the boss with full hp, I almost always do. If you are at half hp and find a campfire don't immeadiately heal, remember you always have a campfire before the main boss, so look for good upgrades and act more defensively, use some potions here and there, you'll get more of them. 

Relics are the way to go so hit up as many elites as you can, with calculated risk of course. I advise you to start going to random encounters as soon as your deck hits 30 cards, it starts getting rather large and encouters might provide some card removal or more relics (the more the better)

For the Ironclad I feel like almost every build seems viable, stregth stacking, perfect strike filled deck, exhaust deck, a more defensive blockade deck with wall of fire, everything just seems to flow well. 

I can't say the same for The Silent as it feels rather weak compared to The Ironclad, the only viable strategies seem to be the Block + Weak + Poison way or the combo shiv way, other than that it feels weak, especially the starting relic (+2 cards in the opening hand, wow really?).

[b]TLDR:[/b]
[list]
[*]You can feel lost during a run, which is deceptively hard/easy;
[*]The RNG can be controlled, you just have to take the right paths, and sometimes make some risky decisions!;
[*]Ironclad is the easy risk class;
[*]The Silent feels rather weak and 5x more difficult to properly manage, I'm sure I'll get used someday;
[*]Relics are the way!
[/list]

Hope you have as much fun as I do!

39592762.review:
Très bon jeu ACTUEL et EN DEVENIR !
Parfait pour tous les amateurs de jeu de cartes et de rogue like, il allie la profondeur du deckbuilding au frisson de l'aléatoire jouissif du rogue like ! J'y ai déjà joué plus de 20h, AUCUNE partie pareille: les différentes possibilités de combo entre toutes les cartes (déjà nombreuses, j'en découvre encore après 20h de jeu) et les nombreuses reliques (qui influence souvent beaucoup votre façon de jouer et de choisir les cartes) rendent la rejouabilité presque infinie !!! 
Déjà si bon en early access !
Avis aux néophytes, le jeu est très facile à prendre en main, on comprend toutes les mécaniques (attaque pouvoir épuisement...) assez vite et toutes les cartes sont TRES BIEN expliquées ! Evidement le jeu étant un rogue like, la difficulté augmente, mais la progression du joueur est rapide et un bonus nous attend à la prochaine partie plus l'on ira loin dans le jeu, rendant la prochaine partie plus aisée.
Le jeu bénéficie déjà d'une traduction FR très correcte dans l'ensemble.
Points négatifs: Plus d'animation rendrait le visuel plus vivant ; Le design pas toujours inspiré de certains monstres et décors ; Plus de variété dans les monstres/Boss serait le bienvenue 
Si le jeu améliore ces quelques faiblesses, continue de s'enrichir en contenu (encore en développement), ce sera certainement un indispensable POUR TOUS !

39587931.review:
Played it for a bit, beat it on both characters after a lot of effort but oh MAN that was satisfying. There is quite a bit of RNG with the cards you find and draw during combat, but it adds to the game in the sense that you have to work with what you have at any given time. It encourages smart plays when it comes to building/pruning you deck and the order in which you play cards.

Difficulty scaling is a bit surprising the first time around with the second level being quite a bit harder than the first. It's definitely designed to be challenging but still remains fun at pretty much all times. Except when you're playing an energy-heavy silent deck and fight the Time Eater. That sucks. Bosses are generally fun though and always give you some good cards that can make some incredible combos.

I bought this almost exclusively because NL was awful at it and I wanted to do better than him and I'm very glad that I have it. All around incredible game.

39581682.review:
2/5

Preface: I understand it is in prerelease so its an unfinished game but my comments wont be about unpolished systems but nonworking ones....

First off way too much hype. It ain't all that and a bag. Its good for about five hours but after that you'll begin to see the glarinly frustrating stifling card systems, such as:

This is a deck building game at its core and therein lies the flaws. 

The game offers limited choice when determining the options avaliable to put in your deck. 1) This is done by severly needlessly limiting the amount of gold the player has access too (even with the golden idol - such a waste). Purchasing cards or deleting cards is rare in a run. 2) Also, the player starts off with the exact same deck for every run. So if you wanted to try a different style of gameplay it is difficult to mold your deck and youre not guaranteed to see any of those cards in later levels thus gimping yourself fromthe get go. Thus wasting 20 or so min on run. 3) There are maybe two deck builld types for each class that are optimal (block, strength and block, poison). If you do rarely manage to get the few golden cards to make the deck work then its gg you win otherwise high chance of loosing. So why utilize the other 75% cards in the game? Skip!

Also, in most rogue-like systems even when you loose you gain incrimental progress towards a greater goal and become just al ittle stronger. There is no system in play like that. Sure you 'unlock' a few new cards that may or may not potentiallly appear in future but 9/10 those cards are pretty shit. 

Like I said, its a fun game for five hours. There are a few suggestions that would make this pre release game MUCH more enjoyable: 1) Give the character increasing benefits at restart for getting further in the run. So far you get the same shitty benefits which dont scale or keep with the character. 2) Increase the gold gained from killing monsteres. Even tier three mobs only give you small pennies when they slapping your ass around. And unlike other rogue like systems you cannot grind. This game is on a rail like system. This would give the player more flexability when building his or her deck and increase the fun! Which is our goal. 3) Allow the player to modify two or three of the starting cards (at least) to cards of equal power but different play style. 

Anyway... lot more stuff to say but no one is going to read this further anyway and I have real life stuff to do. 2/5 for cost.

英文版的时候就达成全成就，最近体验过汉化版。相较于之前，给人明显感觉得到：优化了中立牌、遗物、精英怪的强度平衡

但我还是认为有遗留问题：
1、卡池太深，抽卡了很多次，打了几场都看不到想要的卡
2、牌功能不能百搭就显得鸡肋，没有核心牌组织，只是负增强

针对这些问题我的提议：
1、选择的卡不直接加入卡组，加入暂存区，一旦加入卡组就无法删除，可以解决太“个性”卡过早出现的情况
2、跳过的卡，下次出现的几率降低或者为零，这为以后卡池变深打下良好的基础（这建立在1存在）

39578008.review:
首先，我是推荐这一款游戏的；p
其次，运气成分是占有一定的比例；（
接下来我就说说对于这款游戏的体验
玩游戏无非是为了帅的打爆boss，现阶段这游戏的核心就是成型的卡组，和遗物组合。只要这两个有一个条件吻合，基本上就是挑战成就的时间了。例如战士的烧牌流，力量流，盾牌流，盗贼的飞刀流，毒流，弃牌流（遗物占一半）等，这些只要成型，亦或是接近成型就很舒服了。
不过游戏是不会这么ez的XD，很多时候会就差那一张关键牌而含恨离场，会觉得牌库怎么那么冗杂，也会觉得这小怪怎么打人这么疼！！这其实是作者对玩家的限制，增加运气成分和可玩度，不然总共12张，张张关键牌，轮轮都能打出稳定数据，boss不得气死。
这个游戏可以玩的还有很多，也挺休闲的（感觉比炉石简单），喜欢roguelike和纸牌的不妨一起来受苦，其他细节的可以看其他的评测哟。

下面我要说的就是个人对于这个游戏一点点建议，毕竟受苦多年：
1.商店的买卖系统，现在的版本只能买，不能卖，有时候药水只能丢弃，遗物只能带着
2.药水栏只能装三瓶，我觉得可以增加，甚至可以开发药水流的遗物和卡牌
3.起始牌组可以减少1张打击和1张防御，毕竟洗牌的机会很少，拿牌来的太快（对新手不好）。困难模式可以再恢复13张起手牌
4.联机模式，两三个人一起爬同一张图，当然，随机事件不同，怪物也随机，地图标记一样即可，计时。
5.pvp，这个不太友好，我就提一提。。。。；p

39574916.review:
Roguelite deckbuilder. Each successful run takes about 40-120 minutes depending on how quickly you play.

It's easy to grasp the combat if you've ever played a card game, but it takes a while to get a feel for how good different cards / relics / builds are, and how to choose a route through each map, so I'd say they really nailed the difficulty, and also the balance of strategy vs RNG. It's satisfying to play, even when you don't reach the end.

The only long term unlockables at the moment are archetype / synergy cards. You earn them through EXP, after which they'll start appearing randomly ingame. You may start to feel like there's not much more to achieve after finishing a handful of runs with a couple of different deck archetypes. The aforementioned unlockable cards and the Steam achievements do help, but you shouldn't expect longevity comparable to The Binding of Isaac just yet.

39573933.review:
SUMMARY: A tight, precise, deep, accessible, and challenging "Rougelike deckbuilder."  Climb a randomly generted tower, add cards to your deck of abilities, fight monsters, find treasures, and try to get to the top!  A must-buy for fans of deckbuilders and roguglikes.

Slay the Spire, in concept, is simple:
1) You pick a character, who has a "deck" of abilities.
2) You explore a randomly generated tower, up a step at a time, encountering monsters, mysteries, merchants, and treasure.
3) Fight monsters with your deck of abilities, adding cards as you win, and tweaking it as you go.
4) Buy or find relics and potions to change the course of the game.
5) Encounter random events.
6) Get to the top!

The idea is simple: fight with cards, alter gameplay with relics, get temporary advantages with potions, aquire and tweak cards, and face some random events and choices.

The simplicy makes the game easily accessible.  You can jump in right away.

The complexity?  All these factors interact.  A few cards played smart turns you into a death machine.  A few relics together alters the flow of combat permanently.  A potion at the right time means victory.  Very simple rules and elements combine to create a massively customizable, deep, experience each time you play.

Best of all, this Early Access game offers a lot of gameplay as of this writing - you can even get to the top already (no spoilers).  There's even more coming!

Who's It For:
* A must-buy for fans of deckbuilders or rougelikes.  If you like both, you should have already bought it.
* People that like a precise, deep experience - it's very "puzzly" if you like the basic mechanics.

39572859.review:
So far, this is a great game. It's a turn-based card game with a feel typical to card games like MTG, but much simpler to understand and play. It has a rogue-like dungeon theme to it where as you progress you can win more cards, upgrade cards, find relics to enhance various aspects, etc - but these all only last for your current run and will be gone once you die. At first the game felt too simple, but it definitely gets more challenging as you progress through a run and it never feels unfair. I expected to play for a few minutes after buying to see what it's about but that quickly turned into four hours without realizing it.

And this is early access? Aside from a character that isn't available in early access, you would have no idea that this game is still in development since it already seems so complete and polished. I had no issues with the game at all with everything working as expected, including the user interface being perfect with no annoyances whatsoever.

A tentative reccomendation while it's in early access.

It has the bones of a great deckbuilding game, and is starting to get some meat on it too. I just beat it once (meaning I cleared 3 bosses, which is how far they have right now) on my third go. Some thoughts so far:

 - Once you've figured out what different strategies are availible to a given character after a few playthroughs, the deck manangement aspect of it really comes down to "what will my random drops enable me to do?" Even on my last playthrough, which was a Heavy Strike-centric strength buff build, I still feel like I fell into it, I wanted to do that on my previous playthrough, but the cards that would have enabled it came too late or not at all. Once I had the deck I wanted (at around 35 cards) I stopped picking up new cards (unless they were one-off power cards). 

 - Relics are how you win games, and generally speaking, that's what you should be saving your money for and spending it on (outside of colorless cards that inflict weak/vuln for free). At the beginning of the third level, I got an ice cream cone, which allowed me to keep energy between levels, which, when combined with some +2 energy (-3 hp) cards completely broke the last level for me. I had turns with 6-7 energy per turn on average, which allowed me to play my entire hand every turn. After wiping on the second boss twice, I finished my last run with more than half my health remaining.

 - It might be nice to have an alternative reward to cards at then end of battle encounters. Maybe a relic peice that gives you a random relic if you collect 3. Maybe some extra gold. Once I have the deck I want, I'd rather not pad it with useless cards when I'd rather be able to more quickly reuse important cards during a battle.

 - A neat mechanic might be "?" encounters that manipulate the board in some way. Maybe changing one encounter on your path to a treasure and another to an elite.

Overall, it has the foundation of a great game...it just needs some tuning and more content (obviously).

39569926.review: I am always hesitant to purchase games that are in Early Access-- and I write this review offering you the same caveat.  Games can frequently change during production and shift their design philosophy, and it's definitely possible Mega Crit may do the same, but I think there's something special about this game and the company behind it.  I am the type of person who loves card games, but often miss out on the full experience because I am someone who likes to min-max and netdeck.  This is a game that takes those tools away from you, and I couldn't be more thankful for it.  It allowed me to enjoy the experience of deck building and finding new cards in ways I hadn't felt since playing Pokemon and Yugioh as a little kid.  Not to mention, playing against AI is a lot less prone to inducing saltiness than against real players!  It's worth your time, even at full price and Early Access.

У первого героя вообще нет никаких полезных абилок для лечения в бою и жизнь между боями не восстанавливается(за исключением мест отдыха в которых или восстановить жизнь или апгрейдить карты!!!! ппц идиотичесое решение), т.е. нужно набирать в колоду карт-щитов. Ставишь щиты логично к ним ставить карты, чтобы щиты оставались между ходами. Висят щиты логично ставить карты атаки щитами. Ну все.... Всякие карты увеличивающие аткаку на 1-2, всякие дебафы это какая то лажа, когда у тебя жизни 70, а у боссов 200-400-600 и босс в конце первого этажа может зарядить по тебе на втором ходу на 40+ дамага. Кого ты можешь убить со своим бафом на 2-5 дамага в ход? Но самая главная лажа, это то, что ты НЕ МОЖЕШЬ перед боем составить колоду. Ну вот никак. Все карты которые ты получаешь в награду после боя или подходят тебе в колоду(что очень редко) или приходится отказываться от них. Релики тоже падают случайным образом и чаще всего это какое то говно совершенно бесполезное. Т.е. единсвтенный вариант это начинать и начинать заново в надежде, что в конце концов тебе повезет и тебе выпадут нужные карты и полезные релики. 39563950.review:
I very rarely, if ever, comment on a game on Steam. That said, Slay the Spire is a fantastic blend of deckbuilding and roguelike dungeon crawling. This game manages to harness the replayability of deckbuilding as well as that of procedurally generated roguelike dungeons and makes a compelling game full of thought-provoking decisions that have far-reaching effects on the outcome of your dungeon crawl. Will you accept the deal from the shady trader that will ask you to give up a part of yourself in order to change your basic attacks? Will you accept a curse as a result of a grab for higher power? Will you play a slow-paced, defense-based turtle deck or go all out with stacking stats and attacks?

Best of luck, warrior!

This game has nothing to do with slaying spires but everything to do with cards. This game is very unique in its own right where you play 1 of 2 classes (third still in development) with the task of ascending through 3 randomized stages where the hero meets minion ecounters, random encounters, chests, boss encounters, and stage bosses. The goal is to amass relics that give you different benefits along with a wide variety of cards that synchronize with each other in what is known as a "deck build".

It is difficult yet charming and I continue to come back for another round.

The devs have recently added leaderboards that reset each week.

A must buy for card game type fans!

39556073.review:
This game is pretty decent. It meets the description, it's like deckbuilding games meets rogue-like RPGs. It's quite fun, good looking and good to do runs on. Depens quite much on luck. It'll do so much better if new patches will bring new wide variety of characters. It currently has only 2 which has completely different skill-sets.

The graphics are cute, probably digitally illustrated. I'm no graphics guy but the game looks nice. UI could use some improvement though. And it's a bit clunky at times. For example if you want to play faster and use a bunch of cards, just like in other card games, the game slows down, making you hover something else and make a misplay. Play slower and you are good.

The cards have colors representing sets just like in Magic the Gathering and characters you pick before runs has colored decks. So the game might have multi-colored characters in the future (?). There are also colorless cards you can obtain during runs. There are 3 types of cards Attack, Skill and Power. Attack cards usually damages monsters. Skill cards does some action, usually gaining Block, drawing cards or even damaging monsters. Power cards usually give you in-combat bonuses. You have 3 energy to spend each turn (unless modified by a relic) and you draw 5 cards to play. All cards that are not used are discarded at the end of your turn (again, a relic can modify this) and if there are no cards to draw, your discard pile is shuffled to become your deck again, just like in deckbuilding games. Other than your cards, there are also Curse and Status cards that adds to your deck and does negative stuff. Like wounds in some deck building games or curses that deals damage when in hand, etc. They usually have Unplayable keyword on them, so you can only discard them or Exhaust them with another card effect. Exhaust removes a card from play, so they will not reshuffle back into your deck. Some Skill/Power cards also have Exhaust keyword on them which makes them a one-time-use-per-battle.

As for roguelike elements, you have potions as consumables (3 slots for each character), relics as passive bonuses and your deck as your battling tool. You move around on a randomly generated map, descending floor to floor (you can't traverse backwards). So you have to pick carefully. You can see what lies in front of you, so you can avoid tough monsters or go for merchants when you have a lot of gold. Battles are, as you might guess, turn based. Your character can 'see' what the enemies' next moves will be. So you can prepare against it like blocking beforehand or weakening. There are many mechanics in the game that are in synergy. For example, there is a card that deals double damage on poisoned targets, so you can go for a poison build and keep your enemies poisoned while dealing tons of damage.

There are lots of status effects that you can inflict or gain. Strength/Dexterity gives you more damage/block. Weak/Vulnerable lowers damage dealt/increases damage taken. Posion deals decreasing damage each turn. There are also more rare statuses, like Artifact negates 1 negative status. Confuse, makes your energy costs randomized (which can turn out in your favor).

Also, there is an Upgrade mechanic. In every rest point, you can either heal up or upgrade a card in your deck. Upgrading Attack cards usually increase their damage. Upgrading rare skill cards sometimes remove their Exhaust keyword or decrease their cost. There are also cards that temporarily upgrade your hand/deck during combat. After every run, if you have slain a boss, you gain bonuses on your next run. You can also unlock new cards and relics to get by doing runs.

All-in-all there is so much room for improvement can be done for this game and I can't wait to see what the devs would do in the future. Right now, it's quite fun to play, but suffers from shallow and repetitive content. There are not many synergy decks you can build. Ones that I've tried are Vulnerability Ironclad, Strength Ironclad, Discard Silent, Poison Silent. There are many synergy decks you can do, but since it's a roguelike game and stuff you get is random, it's hard to build things. Maybe a new fun game-mode where you build your deck and try to go through enemies, without relics? Like survival mode? I don't know, as I've said so much room for improvement.

Giving it a 8.5 out of 10 because it's very fun to mess around.

39550690.review:
I'd like to report a bug. There's a boss monster in the game called the Time Eater which the game says I have not yet encountered, but I must have because hours of my life disappeared upon booting up this game. Developers, please fix.

Pros:
 - Great tactical gameplay through combination of deck building mechanics and incorporation of permanent augments via relics.
 - Interesting and engaging challenges presented via the bosses and monsters.
 - Considerable mechanical variety between the available characters allows for a unique experience, even on repeat playthroughs.
 - Simple to play, but lots of fun options to explore when it comes to deck design.
 - Most monsters engage you beyond just damage/debuff/defense tactics.

Cons:
 - Card art is blotchy and not always representitive of its effects.
 - More card, character and enemy variety sorely needed (Early Access)
 - Not all relics are created equal. Certain drops turn runs into a breeze.

Would Recommend To:
Fans of deck-building cards games (especially those lacking in friends with similar interests). Fans of tactical card games. People who wished Hands of Fate had more to do with actual card game mechanics. CARDS!

39549603.review:
It's been such a long time since I've loved a game this much that came seemingly out of nowhere. I'm addicted. The roguelike-meets-card game idea works absolutely perfectly, and that's coming from someone who doesn't even play either of those genres seperately.

The replayability can definitely be expanded upon, however it's surely more replayable than people give it credit for. Just needs more cards/relics/characters, which I'm sure is planned in future updates/full release.

However the one real complaint I have is in the balancing issues. Overall, in combat it plays fairly balanced (although there are a few cards that make a run WAY too easy), but the devs balance cards each patch, so by the full release it shouldn't be much of an issue. What I'm really talking about is the level layout. There's usually a pretty easy path to the boss, and if you get good RNG on a few ? rooms, it gets pretty easy. Maybe the choice of a more difficult tower (normal: 3 levels/50 floors, hard: 5 levels/100 floors, insane: 10 levels/250 floors, or something like that) could change things up.

Still, this game is extremely fun and worth the current price, even in EA. I can only imagine what else the devs have in store for the future and I'd absolutely recommend this to anyone who is even slightly interested by what they see here.

39549315.review:
Absolutely fenomenal. 

Compared to other Rogue-like games it doesn't screw you over EVERY step of the way, yet still manages to be very challenging. Amount of content is amazing - bought it 2 days ago and have almost 27 hours played as of now. 

"Completed"(no true ending YET) three times, but I'll keep playing because there's still a lot of things I  haven't unlocked(and every unlock adds game-changing abilities/relics). 

The game is technically VERY polished,doesn't feel like early access AT ALL. Dozens of enemies,hundreds of cards,over a hundred game-changing relics, potions, status effects, random encounters + what's listed in the roadmap.

 I absolutely love this game and hope they add EVEN more cool things/classes/enemies in the future. This may be the first single-player rogue-like I'll clock over 100 hours in and actually enjoy it every step of the way.


 If you're not convinced yet,here's the development roadmap from the official thread
(CONTENT ONLY- UI,engine changes and the like excluded):

    The Third Character.
    Enemies: At least three more combat encounters for level 3.
    Game Modes: Daily Challenge & Infinity Mode (Unofficial Name)
    Cards: At least 90 more cards
    Relics: At least 25 more relics.
    Events: At least 10 more events.
    Potions: There'll be more to chug, quaff, and chuck.
    The True Ending + Secrets

Not going to lie I enjoyed this game a lot more when I thought the card pick ups and upgrades were permanent.  Alas they are not though and upon death your successes and joy die. 

I don't normally play or enjoy card or even turn based games but this one has just enough of a dungeon crawler feel to it and interesting enough loot drops to keep me engaged. 

Graphics are minimalist and I love it. Keeps it relaxing and to me it matches the playstyle of the game well. 

Just because I'm a loot hungry whore I'd love think there is a possibility for an alternative playthrough where upgrades and card pick ups persist through death but even if that doesn't happen I have just over 20 hours played and am very satisfied with my purchase. 

Well played.

39545535.review:
The early 2000s flash game art style may give the game the appearance of some cute time waster, but this game actually has a great deal of depth in its mechanics. Each enemy type always behave more or less the same, but your cards are semi random and you have to try to put together a strategy on the fly. Think of it like drafting a MtG deck, but playing a short game every time you pick a new card. And it is complex enough that even vets of MtG will find they have to really think to win. It defnitely fills a much needed niche on Steam of strategic card games, but with some fun twists. 

Even in early access the game is totally stable. My only gripes with it are the somewhat limited content, which is being worked on, and the balance. Some of the stronger random enemies make certain builds essentially non viable in the event that you run into them, even if you were decimating everyone else. Otherwise a great game and absolutely worth a purchase if you need to scratch that card game itch.

39544253.review:
EARLY ACCESS: Great little game, you should get it if you like rouge-like dungeon crawlers and card based combat systems.  or maybe if you like seeing something a little different than your run of the mill AAA title.

The game is short, and feels more like an introduction than a full game - but you should easily be able to have fun for a week or two with the content that currently exists.  Hopefully they have plans on adding more content to keep the adventure going.

39544207.review:
I fell in love with this game, +30 hours already [i bought 2 days ago]

Strategy-wise it is not INFINITE, but when you know a bit about the possible axis you wanna take, according to what you find along the way, it is pretty darn enjoyable to craft an always surprising set of cards, relics and curses, and play around it.

EARLY ACCESS
For now, you got 2 "decks" available [2 characters : one tank/soldier and one rogue/ninja] and 3 levels available.
One entire run takes about 1-2 hours, and there is probably about 8-10 different bosses, randomly spawning at the end of each stage.

The bestiary may lack abit of diversity - but it's actually a kinda advantage, in the sense that when you roamed the dungeon a few times, you'll know what to expect at certain checkpoints, thus allowing you to build your deck accordingly.

A very good game indeed ! I can't wait to see what additional contents the devs are going to introduce !

A really good game in spite of it being in early acces.
I like to play this game when I have a little free-time on my hands and dont wanna commit to a heavy story based or massive multiplayer game. The ever changing rooms and random items makes  replayabilty possible and it isn't going to get boring at all.
